98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 Bash the lemongrass firmly with a knife handle or wooden spoon then finely chop it. Slice the cucumber and radish and put in a bowl. Finely slice the carrot, red cabbage and spring onions and place in a separate bowl
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 Mix rice vinegar, sugar, soy sauce and two tbsp of oil in a bowl before dividing the mixture into two separate bowls. In the first bowl add teriyaki sauce
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 In the second bowl add grated ginger and garlic. Marinate your salmon in this mixture and add a generous pinch of salt and pepper, then leave to sit
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 Heat up the mixture in your second bowl (in which you added the teriyaki sauce) in a non-stick saucepan until it has thickened slightly and has become sticky
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 In a small bowl, mix the sliced cucumber and radishes with 1 tsp of rice wine vinegar, a pinch of salt and sugar. Mix then set aside to pickle
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan on a medium to high heat. Add 2 salmon fillets skin side down and fry until each side is coloured and the skin is crispy. Then set aside while you repeat with the other two
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 In the same pan, add Limited Edition Japanese Teriyaki rice and lemongrass. Fry until hot and slightly crispy. This should take a few minutes
98288f19-696a-4075-92fa-7c7502604722 To assemble your bento bowl, add the rice at the bottom then place salmon on top with the pickles and sliced rainbow vegetables. Before serving add a drizzle of the sticky dressing
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed In a small saucepan, cover eggs with water, bring to the boil and then simmer for 6 minutes. Once cooked, add eggs to ice cold water so they can cool
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Cover the haddock and 1 kaffir lime leaf in some water in a saucepan. Poach for 5 minutes on a simmering heat
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Remove the fish and leaf from the pan and leave to the side. You can flake your fish at the end
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Add a tbsp of oil over a medium heat in a large saucepan and saute the finely diced onion. Then add the mustard and cumin seeds and heat for a few more minutes
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Stir in the peel, grated ginger and garlic and saute for a minute before adding curry powder, kaffir lime leaf, a squeeze of lemon juice, zest, salt, pepper and a tbsp of oil
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Stir through the Tilda Coconut rice and add 2 tbsp of water to loosen up the mixture
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Once cooked, remove from the heat, flake the fish and season with a tbsp of oil, salt and pepper. Then de-shell the two eggs and quarter them
d96caf51-9e6a-413f-bff7-b8314d33ebed Serve up the rice and add the quartered eggs. Then sprinkle on some chopped coriander
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Cook the potatoes, cauliflower and carrots in boiling water for 10-15 minutes until soft. Drain and cool
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Heat the oil in a large pan and add the onions, garlic and ginger and fry for about 5 minutes to soften
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Add the Rogan Josh paste and black onion seeds and heat for a couple of minutes
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Add the chopped tomatoes, cooked vegetables, chickpeas and water and simmer for 5- 10 minutes
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Add the fresh tomato quarters and heat for a couple of minutes
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Season with salt and pepper and serve piping hot
ee517ff7-7f8a-42ab-a347-97e1f2fd91ef Heat the Tilda Pure Basmati rice according to pack instructions and serve with the curry
50e38f23-680c-4ad2-82a1-7b4eb09521de Heat the oil in a medium frying pan and add the garlic and ginger. Cook for 3 minutes until softened
50e38f23-680c-4ad2-82a1-7b4eb09521de Add the lemongrass, coconut milk, stock and rendang paste. Mix to combine then turn up the heat and bring to the boil. Simmer for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until reduced by half. Taste and season with salt if needed
50e38f23-680c-4ad2-82a1-7b4eb09521de Carefully remove the lemongrass from the sauce and blend until smooth before returning the sauce to the pan. Add the beef strips to the hot sauce and simmer gently for a further 2-3 minutes until the meat is cooked and tender
50e38f23-680c-4ad2-82a1-7b4eb09521de Heat the Tilda Coconut rice according to pack instructions. Steam the Pak Choi for 2 minutes until wilted
50e38f23-680c-4ad2-82a1-7b4eb09521de Top the hot rice with the beef strips and pour over the curry sauce. Serve with the steamed pak choi along-side. Garnish with lime wedges, red chilli and toasted coconut shavings (if using)
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 Preheat the grill to high
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 String a cube of the lamb on a skewer, then thread on a spring onion and repeat until you have 4 lamb cubes and 3 spring onions per skewer . Brush with olive oil and place onto an oven tray and under the grill. Cook the lamb for 4 minutes, turn the skewers over, then repeat for a final 4 minutes
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 Whilst the lamb is cooking, combine the cumin, garlic granules and chilli powder to make the spice mix
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 Once the meat is ready, remove from the grill and sprinkle generously with the spice mix on all sides and rest under a sheet of kitchen foil to keep warm
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 Blitz the parsley and mint in a food processor until finely chopped. Tip into a large bowl and add the ground allspice, cloves, cherry tomatoes, lemon juice and a tablespoon of olive oil. Season generously with salt and pepper
3f351e44-b6be-424a-94c9-6f0e74733060 Cook the Tilda Wholegrain Basmati & Wild rice according to pack instructions. Toss the parsley mixture with the hot rice and lay the warm lamb skewers on top of the tabbouleh and scatter over the pomegranate seeds
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Preheat the oven to 240C, 220C fan or gas 7. Line an oven tray with baking parchment
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Place the vinegar and cornflour in a medium sized saucepan and whisk until the cornflour has disappeared. Next add the sweet chilli sauce and paprika. Heat the sauce until the marinade has thickened. It needs to coat the back of a spoon but still be runny
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Add the cauliflower florets to the hot sauce and toss the cauliflower in the sauce until completely covered
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Tip the sticky cauliflower onto an oven tray lined with baking parchment and sprinkle over the sesame seeds. Finally, drizzle over the sesame oil
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Cook in the middle of the hot oven for 15 - 20 minutes until golden and cooked
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Whilst the cauliflower is cooking, cut the tomatoes in half and spoon out the seeds. Roughly chop the flesh. Cook the peas in boiling water, then drain
a3e3d9f5-3d5c-4de7-8081-be40d7c5ebfd Just before the cauliflower is ready, heat the pouch of Tilda Peri Peri rice according to pack instructions then mix through the tomatoes and drained peas. Top the prepared hot rice with the cauliflower and sprinkle over the coriander. Serve straight away
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Pre-heat the oven to 200°c, 180°c fan, gas mark 6
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Mix together the honey, mirin and soy sauce
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Place the salmon in a tray and coat with half the honey mix
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Cover with foil and cook in the oven for 10 minutes
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Remove the foil and coat the salmon with the remaining honey mix
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Sprinkle over the sesame seeds
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Return to the oven and cook for a further 10 minutes or until the salmon is cooked
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Add the oil to a griddle pan and heat until hot. Halve the pak choi lengthwise and griddle in the pan until charred and soft
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Heat the pouch of Tilda Limited Edition Japanese Teriyaki rice in the microwave for 2 minutes
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Place the rice in a bowl with the pak choi to the side
efd732d4-b31b-433f-8bdc-800280a4b012 Top with the salmon
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Pre-heat the grill on high
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Empty half of the pouch of the Tilda Limited Edition Japanese Teriyaki Rice into a small food processor and whizz until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl and add the remainder of the rice. Mix well
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Divide the mix into four. Mould each quarter into a triangular shape squeezing the rice well to compact it
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Grease a baking tray with oil. Place the onigiri on the tray and grill for 5- 7 minutes. Turn over and grill the other side for 5-7 minutes
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Remove from the oven and coat both sides with soy sauce. Return to the grill for 3-4 minutes to crisp up
65ef8717-d89c-43ce-b51f-96d25e8eebae Remove from the grill and sprinkle with sesame seeds
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Mix the sliced chicken with the soy sauce
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Add the oil and butter to a large pan and add the onions. Fry for 5 – 7 minutes until softened. Add the garlic and ginger and fry for 2-3 minutes
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Add the chicken and fry until cooked. Remove onions, garlic, ginger and chicken from the pan
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Beat the eggs and add to the pan to scramble
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Add the rice and spring onions and mix together well
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a Add the cooked chicken and onions back into the pan and heat thoroughly until the rice is slightly crispy
f3fcf439-2963-4b38-ad3a-e53d0d7cbd1a To serve, sprinkle over with toasted sesame seeds
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Marinade the lamb in the paste for 5-10 minutes or longer if possible
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Heat the oil in a large pan and add the onions, garlic and ginger and fry for about 5 minutes to soften
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Add the marinated lamb and fry for 5 minutes to seal
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Add the chopped tomatoes, black onion seeds and water and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the lamb is tender
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Add the fresh tomato quarters and heat for a couple of minutes
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Season with salt and pepper and serve piping hot
2bedce33-d00b-44af-81c4-66d73ed79c93 Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice as per pouch instructions and serve alongside the curry
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Heat the oil in a large pan and add the onions, garlic, ginger, chilli and pepper and fry for about 5 -7 minutes to soften
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Add the curry powder and cook for 1-2 minutes
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato puree, peri peri sauce, water and preserved lemon and simmer for 5 minutes
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Stir in the prawns and cook until they turn pink
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Season with salt and pepper and serve piping hot
48ea6696-be53-478e-ad46-3cbec34e3928 Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice as per pouch instructions and serve alongside the curry
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Heat the oil and butter in a large pan and add the onions, garlic and ginger and fry for about 5 minutes to soften
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Add the korma paste and cook for 1 minute
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Add the chicken and fry until sealed and slightly browned
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Add the chopped tomatoes and water and cook uncovered for 15 minutes
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Add the coconut yoghurt and almonds and stir through
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Season with salt and pepper and serve piping hot
414c33e1-8662-4bf5-a533-521e2c4ba783 Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice as per pouch instructions and serve alongside the curry
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Mix the natural yoghurt and tikka paste together and then add the chicken breast chunks. Leave to marinade
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Heat the oil in a large pan and add the onions, garlic and ginger and fry for about 5 minutes to soften
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Add the marinated chicken and fry until sealed and slightly browned
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Add the chopped tomatoes, smoked salt and water and cook uncovered for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Add the butter and lemon juice and heat through
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Finish by swirling in the double cream
dd28e87e-5ca3-41c2-9bc7-7cc0d66c323a Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice as per pouch instructions and serve alongside the curry
80635254-e63d-425a-8582-3b24076f21c6 Fry chopped onion and peppers in olive oil for 5-7 minutes until softened.
80635254-e63d-425a-8582-3b24076f21c6 Stir through the olives and the rice.
80635254-e63d-425a-8582-3b24076f21c6 Heat through thoroughly and season to taste with salt and pepper. Keep warm.
80635254-e63d-425a-8582-3b24076f21c6 Cut the halloumi into slices and griddle for a few minutes.
80635254-e63d-425a-8582-3b24076f21c6 Stir torn rocket leaves through the rice and top with the griddled halloumi slices to serve.
c951f69e-2fd1-438a-af69-e520e5194092 Add all ingredients to a pan on a high heat
c951f69e-2fd1-438a-af69-e520e5194092 Keep stirring until the mixture boils
c951f69e-2fd1-438a-af69-e520e5194092 Once it has boiled, reduce the heat and allow the mixture to simmer until it has become a thick, porridge like consistency
c951f69e-2fd1-438a-af69-e520e5194092 Pour into a bowl and top with whatever you like
c951f69e-2fd1-438a-af69-e520e5194092 You can use Tilda Brown Wholegrain as a filling alternative.
085360d0-2936-47f1-98e6-db4bea5e824c Fry 3 diced chicken thighs in olive oil with the chopped onion and paprika.
085360d0-2936-47f1-98e6-db4bea5e824c When the chicken is cooked through, pour over the chicken stock and a sprig of rosemary.
085360d0-2936-47f1-98e6-db4bea5e824c Stir in the rice, add the prawns and peas and leave to bubble away for a few minutes.
085360d0-2936-47f1-98e6-db4bea5e824c When all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is covered in a thick coating of sauce it is ready. Serve with a lemon wedge.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions and cook for 10-15 minutes on low to medium heat until golden.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 To this add the ginger and garlic and cook for another 2 minutes.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Now add the tomatoes and cook on low heat for 10 minutes until the tomatoes have softened.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Add all the spices to this with the ketchup and cook for a minute.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Remove this mixture in a bowl and keep it aside.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 In the same pan heat the oil and when hot add the onions and peppers.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes then add the spice mixture that was prepared earlier.
c310f706-c6ab-4dde-947f-eb45f3d914b9 Mix it all well and then add the paneer, heat for a minute then serve with some piping hot Tilda Pure Basmati rice.
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 Thinly slice the onion
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 Caramelise one half in a frying pan on a low medium heat, until dark brown but not burned. This will take about 20 minutes
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 Once done, pour the onions in to the rice and cook the rice according to packet instructions, with no deviation from water amount etc
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 While the rice is cooking, shallow fry the rest of the onions in batches until crispy
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 Combine the rice cooked with onions once done, with the can of lentils in equal amounts
7f082543-6a30-4c34-b70e-73de2f1b4f00 Garnish with parsley and pomegranate seeds, and serve with yoghurt on the side
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Butter can burn very easily, so make sure throughout recipe a low to medium heat is used.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Rinse the Basmati rice in water till the water runs clear, then soak rice for half an hour. Once soaked, drain and put to the side.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Slice the onions and put to one side.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 On a medium to low heat melt the butter in a large saucepan.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Add the nuts to the butter and cook till golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and use at the end.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Add the whole cardamom pods and sliced onions in the butter. Add your curry powder, bay leaves, turmeric and chilli powder. Cook for a couple of minutes until fragrant and the onions are tender.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Now add the soaked rice and stir altogether for 1 minute, making sure the rice does not stick to the bottom of the pan but is glossy and buttery.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Cover with water. Don’t forget to add a generous pinch of salt.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Get the pan to a gentle simmer and then cover for 7 mins.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Once cooked and all the water is absorbed add a tablespoon of butter on top and put the lid back on for a couple of minutes.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 In a frying pan cook your fried egg at a high heat in butter for the ultimate crisped edges.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Remove lid sand fluff the rice with a fork then stir in the buttered pistachios.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Squeeze in your lemon juice and season.
7e9e4b88-9c9f-40f5-8358-251ac4a20b59 Serve up your fragrant curried rice with a sunny side egg on top and some chopped mint.
34e5b981-8692-412e-ac2a-0bf933814403 Heat a deep pan with a glug of olive oil / coconut oil, then add the finely chopped onion, chilli and ginger & fry for 6-7 minutes
34e5b981-8692-412e-ac2a-0bf933814403 Add the finely chopped garlic cloves and fry for a further 1-2 minutes until cooked before adding the tinned coconut milk, birdseye chillies, bay leaves and spices
34e5b981-8692-412e-ac2a-0bf933814403 Mix the plant-based milk with the lemon juice and leave to curdle before adding to the pan and allow to sit on a low heat for around 10 minutes
34e5b981-8692-412e-ac2a-0bf933814403 Meanwhile in a pot add 150g Tilda Pure Original Basmati with 300ml water, large pinch of salt and allow to simmer with the lid on for around 10-15 minutes (it should absorb the water and be perfectly cooked and fluffy)
34e5b981-8692-412e-ac2a-0bf933814403 Taste test the curry adding a little more salt & pepper if needed then serve up!
273e13a4-c316-48ec-b764-c340813aca83 Mix together the sesame oil, ginger, honey, Chinese five spice and soy sauce. Coat the chicken with the honey.
273e13a4-c316-48ec-b764-c340813aca83 Add the chicken to a hot griddle pan or wok and fry until cooked and a lovely golden brown colour. Set aside and keep warm.
273e13a4-c316-48ec-b764-c340813aca83 Heat the oil in pan and gently fry the spring onions until soft. Heat the rice in the microwave for 1 minute and then add to the spring onions.
273e13a4-c316-48ec-b764-c340813aca83 To serve heap the rice mixture into a large bowl and top with the chicken. Drizzle any leftover juices over the chicken and finish with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds (if using).
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Blanch the broccoli in lightly salted boiling water for 2 minutes, drain then set aside.
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Mix together the hoisin sauce, Chinese five spice powder, garlic, ginger and pork in a large bowl and leave to marinade for at least 30 minutes (if you have time you can make this the night before).
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Heat the oil in a large non-stick wok or frying pan and stir-fry the onion for 2 minutes.
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Lift the meat from the marinade, shaking off the excess. Add the meat to the wok and stir-fry for 4 minutes. Keep the marinade aside.
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Meanwhile, cook the rice according to pack instructions.
675caca3-7f1b-47fe-8276-99a32b65afae Add the broccoli, spring onion and reserved marinade to the pork mixture and stir-fry for 2 minutes until piping hot. Serve spooned over the rice.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Place the chilli and spring onion into a bowl of ice cold water and set aside while cooking the curry.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Dry fry the peanuts in a small pan for 1-2 minutes until toasted. Set aside.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Place coconut milk, chicken stock, cinnamon stick and curry paste into a large saucepan and bring to the boil.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Stir in the chicken and potatoes , cover and cook over a low heat for 20 minutes or until the chicken and potatoes are tender and cooked through.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Discard the cinnamon stick. Stir in half the coriander, lime zest and juice and season to taste.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Cook the rice according to pack instructions then arrange into individual serving dishes.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Spoon over the Massaman curry. Scatter over the peanuts and remaining coriander. Drain the spring onions and scatter over the curry to serve.
b5f1a132-dd4e-450d-aa22-58d3b443e142 Serve with lime wedges to be squeezed over to taste.
010cd822-3a9a-4e74-9c11-9abc2296c3cc Preheat the oven to 180/Gas mark 5.
010cd822-3a9a-4e74-9c11-9abc2296c3cc Cut a generous square of tin foil, brush the oil over the fish and place on the foil.
010cd822-3a9a-4e74-9c11-9abc2296c3cc Add the other ingredients (except the rice).
010cd822-3a9a-4e74-9c11-9abc2296c3cc Draw up the corners to make a loose parcel and leave a small hole at the top.
eac20a19-05b0-45fe-ba6a-62dfc392d31c Place the frozen peas in a pan of boiling water and cook for 4-5 minutes.
eac20a19-05b0-45fe-ba6a-62dfc392d31c Drain and set aside.
c8f16f24-46fd-4b18-b0dc-8eb67fd3f0ef Dice the mixed peppers and slice the onions. Cut the feta into small cubes.
c8f16f24-46fd-4b18-b0dc-8eb67fd3f0ef Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice according to pouch instructions and place into a serving bowl.
c8f16f24-46fd-4b18-b0dc-8eb67fd3f0ef Mix in the olives, peppers, onions and feta, as well as the spice mix, herbs and chickpeas.
c8f16f24-46fd-4b18-b0dc-8eb67fd3f0ef Squeeze over the lemon before serving.
f0299dc1-7762-448b-9eef-d5ae387a275a Add the coconut oil, garlic, ginger, red chilli, red onion and broccoli to a large frying pan or wok. Cook over a medium heat, stirring gently, until the onion begins to soften, about 3-4 minutes.
f0299dc1-7762-448b-9eef-d5ae387a275a Add the coconut Super Grains and edamame beans and continue to cook for a further 2-3 minutes until heated through.
f0299dc1-7762-448b-9eef-d5ae387a275a Add the grated carrot and stir to combine.
f0299dc1-7762-448b-9eef-d5ae387a275a To make the sauce, whisk together all sauce ingredients. Add to the pan and stir to combine.
f0299dc1-7762-448b-9eef-d5ae387a275a Divide between two bowls and top with the peanuts.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Preheat the oven to 200°C, gas mark 6. Use a non stick 21cm oven proof frying pan.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Add the oil to the pan with the chopped tomatoes and onion or any other vegetables you may want to use up.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Fry until softened.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Whisk the eggs.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Heat the rice according to pack instructions. Mix the rice with the tomatoes, add the peas, eggs and half of the cheese. Season to taste.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Sprinkle over the remaining cheese. Bake for 15 minutes until golden in the same pan.
f2f4a1b6-0cb9-48ef-9f77-eabbfd659b7c Slice into wedges and serve with green salad.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Preheat the oven to 200°C, gas mark 6.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Cook the rice gently with the spices and 250ml water, covered for 10-12 minutes or until tender.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Cool slightly and mix in the mincemeat.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Cut all the filo sheets into 4 squares.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Place 1 square on the work surface and brush with melted butter, place another square on top at an angle and brush with butter repeat with another 2 squares.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Press into a deep muffin tray. Repeat to make 12 pastry shells.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Spoon the rice mixture in the middle of each shell.
326f3e8e-fd00-434a-9d57-aee682c1e59a Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden. Dust with icing sugar before serving.
fd9087ac-a0b8-4fd4-b55b-36778241765a Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion until soft.
fd9087ac-a0b8-4fd4-b55b-36778241765a Add the curry paste and the haddock for 3 - 4 minutes.
fd9087ac-a0b8-4fd4-b55b-36778241765a Meanwhile, heat the rice according to the pack instructions then add to the pan with the peas and heat through.
fd9087ac-a0b8-4fd4-b55b-36778241765a Stir in the parsley and season to taste.
fd9087ac-a0b8-4fd4-b55b-36778241765a Serve piping hot garnished with the eggs and a squeeze of lemon juice.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd For Miso Tahini Dressing, mix all the ingredients together and set aside.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd Drain the tofu, place on a plate between kitchen towel and place a heavy object such as a chopping board or cookbook on top to press for 5-10 minutes to remove excess moisture.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd Meanwhile, peel the carrot and slice into thin strips about 1cm in diameter.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd Halve the tofu lenthways, then cut into slices 1cm thick , place in a bowl and pour the miso-tahini marinade over. Let it sit for 10-15 minutes.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd Cut the avocado in half, remove the skin and stone and slice the flesh lengthways.
2edfa2ec-e8e0-4e1f-812c-71b889f61afd Trim and peel the spring onion, and slice thinly into strips.
57e7ba38-1162-41df-b359-e34f416f5155 Grease 4 x 175g ramekins or dariole moulds.
57e7ba38-1162-41df-b359-e34f416f5155 Cook rice according to the pack, and allow to cool slightly.
57e7ba38-1162-41df-b359-e34f416f5155 Stir the crabmeat, crayfish, chives, lime zest and juice from half the lime into rice, chill until needed.
57e7ba38-1162-41df-b359-e34f416f5155 Press into the moulds then up-turn onto plates and serve with salad and lime wedges
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 To make the marinade, mix the olive oil, lemon juice and oregano together. Season well with salt and pepper
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Lay the sliced halloumi on a plate and cover with the marinade
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Meanwhile make the salad. Heat the oil in a large pan and fry the red onion until soft
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Add the tomatoes, olives, and Tilda Super Grains Garlic and Ginger
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Heat through and keep warm
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Add all the drizzle ingredients to a mini food processor and blitz until smooth
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Add the marinated halloumi to a griddle pan and cook until golden brown on both sides, adding any remaining marinade juices to the rice mix
fe56e19c-472b-430f-8fd3-88e46032e3a8 Serve in a large bowl and drizzle over the basil & mint dressing
4b24ad26-d275-4727-8a39-6bfd3b5bf10d Heat the coconut oil in a large pan or wok. Add the garlic, ginger, lime leaves, red chilli and spring onions. Fry for a few minutes until softened
4b24ad26-d275-4727-8a39-6bfd3b5bf10d Stir in the lemongrass paste, prawns and Pak Choi and continue cooking until the prawns turn pink and the whole dish is piping hot
4b24ad26-d275-4727-8a39-6bfd3b5bf10d Just before serving stir through the coriander
c082b212-d946-4a8e-976c-acb69bae49c7 For a beautifully fragrant Indian style dish, start with a diced red and yellow pepper, a chopped onion and a finely sliced red chilli.
c082b212-d946-4a8e-976c-acb69bae49c7 Fry gently in a little oil until softened.
c082b212-d946-4a8e-976c-acb69bae49c7 Add a small pack of cooked tikka or tandoori chicken pieces and cook until the chicken is heated through.
c082b212-d946-4a8e-976c-acb69bae49c7 Gently stir in the Tilda Pure Steamed Basmati Rice and when it is piping hot and ready to eat
c082b212-d946-4a8e-976c-acb69bae49c7 Serve with a simple dressing of natural yoghurt and chopped mint.
c5345c4a-cc05-43a4-8326-be89ff324385 Stir fry 2 finely chopped spring onions and 1 sliced red pepper until softened.
c5345c4a-cc05-43a4-8326-be89ff324385 Add a pack of precooked BBQ chicken slices and heat through.
c5345c4a-cc05-43a4-8326-be89ff324385 Heat the Tilda Golden Vegetable rice in the microwave for 2 minutes and add to the pan.
c5345c4a-cc05-43a4-8326-be89ff324385 Warm 4 flour tortillas and fill with rice and chicken mix.
c5345c4a-cc05-43a4-8326-be89ff324385 Top with grated cheese, roll and enjoy with BBQ dip.
d4d2b845-be28-42e2-b31d-8c4122aa0d23 Chop all veg and garlic. Pan fry the ginger, garlic and onions
d4d2b845-be28-42e2-b31d-8c4122aa0d23 Add all other veg to the pan with parsley
d4d2b845-be28-42e2-b31d-8c4122aa0d23 Make a basic guacamole with tomatoes, avocado and lime
d4d2b845-be28-42e2-b31d-8c4122aa0d23 Add prawns to pan of vegetables, adding water if necessary
d4d2b845-be28-42e2-b31d-8c4122aa0d23 After 5 mins mix rice into pan stirring well. Serve in tacos with a side of guacamole
9c0813a0-87ac-47ee-9117-c129afc31a8a Chop up onions, thyme, chilli and peppers
0c6db644-3b47-4c42-853b-c4f24fd2dd7c In a medium bowl combine turmeric powder, paprika, cumin, thyme, crushed red pepper flakes, ground black pepper, salt, and 1 tbsp olive oil.
0c6db644-3b47-4c42-853b-c4f24fd2dd7c Add shrimp to the bowl, and mix well to coat.
0c6db644-3b47-4c42-853b-c4f24fd2dd7c In a large deep sauté pan, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat and add the shrimp.
0c6db644-3b47-4c42-853b-c4f24fd2dd7c Cook shrimp until it's cooked through, then add garlic in the last minute but make sure that it does not burn.
0c6db644-3b47-4c42-853b-c4f24fd2dd7c Remove from heat, and squeeze lime over shrimp. Serve with Tilda Caribbean Rice and Peas and a simple salad on the side.
71715fae-0b4d-46a3-9c6a-cbfd6d1b1f11 Sauté the cauliflower, ginger, garlic, and shallots in a pan. Add mustard seeds
71715fae-0b4d-46a3-9c6a-cbfd6d1b1f11 Add some coconut milk and fish sauce
71715fae-0b4d-46a3-9c6a-cbfd6d1b1f11 Add the cod into the pan and fry
71715fae-0b4d-46a3-9c6a-cbfd6d1b1f11 Add the steamed coconut rice
71715fae-0b4d-46a3-9c6a-cbfd6d1b1f11 Add some broccoli and leave to simmer
6ae01518-80cd-4072-b61b-7f1ad98be8e1 Marinate cod in chipotle paste and lime for at least 10 minutes
c2639553-8a06-4bcc-97da-a1c5de439a28 Chop cod ready for marinading in the spicy chipotle paste
f7c3c422-1e1b-4850-8bf3-4b4c53fdd654 Fry the onions and peppers with a little chopped chilli
f7c3c422-1e1b-4850-8bf3-4b4c53fdd654 When soft, add the broccoli and sweetcorn
f7c3c422-1e1b-4850-8bf3-4b4c53fdd654 Add Peri Peri rice and stir well for three to four minutes
f7c3c422-1e1b-4850-8bf3-4b4c53fdd654 Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds and a squeeze of lemon
f7c3c422-1e1b-4850-8bf3-4b4c53fdd654 Garnish with thyme leaves
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Preheat the oven to 180 C.
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Grind together the spices with half the lime.
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Coat the salmon, wrap in foil and bake for 20-25 minutes
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Meanwhile cook your greens in salted boiling water for 8 minutes.
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Heat the rice as per the instructions on the pack.
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Bring together the cooked salmon with your rice and greens.
a65bce65-88df-4d04-856a-61cc133c4a5d Garnish with the rest of the lime, sliced red chilli and a sprinkle of fresh coriander.
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Heat the oil in a pan
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Add the cinnamon stick and allow to infuse for two minutes
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Add the vegetables, season with salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes until soft
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Add the Tilda Steamed Basmati rice, chickpeas, lemon and sultanas
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Cook on a medium heat for around 5 minutes until heated through
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Add the chopped parsley and fluff the rice with a fork
ed409289-4593-4d49-a146-6ee9b96baf53 Transfer to a serving dish, scatter over the flaked almonds, add dollops of Greek yoghurt and drizzle over the harissa paste
fcdb344d-a713-452b-a94e-dfda17e7eb74 Heat the oil in a large frying pan and sauté the onion for 5 minutes until softened
fcdb344d-a713-452b-a94e-dfda17e7eb74 Add the lamb and dried herbs and cook for a few minutes until the lamb is heated through thoroughly
fcdb344d-a713-452b-a94e-dfda17e7eb74 Add the sundried tomatoes and rocket. Heat the rice according to pack instruction and add to the pan. Stir well
fcdb344d-a713-452b-a94e-dfda17e7eb74 Spread each tortilla with a tablespoon of houmous, top with the lamb rice mixture and roll up.
16912d8f-3cd7-48c7-b931-0df6eefdacba Heat the oil in a frying pan, add the shallots, garlic and ginger and fry for 5-6 minutes, until golden-brown
16912d8f-3cd7-48c7-b931-0df6eefdacba Add the chicken and coriander and stir fry for another 4-5 minutes, and then add the spices and stir for one minute
16912d8f-3cd7-48c7-b931-0df6eefdacba Stir in the yoghurt and simmer for 1-2 minutes
16912d8f-3cd7-48c7-b931-0df6eefdacba Add the almonds and raisins, cover the pan and allow to cook over a low heat for 10 minutes
16912d8f-3cd7-48c7-b931-0df6eefdacba Add the rice to the pan and heat until cooked through, then serve.
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Fry onions in a little oil until soft, add the chilli paste
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Add the turkey mince and fry until browned all over
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Add the beans, tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Add the rice to the pan and cook, covered over a low heat for a further 5 minutes
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Season to taste and add a little water if needed
e3fe5769-35e7-4ca7-bfe0-1a72d70e1996 Serve with sour cream dip optional
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 To make koftas: Pre-heat oil for deep frying
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 In a bowl, mix together paneer, lauki and potato
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add red chilli, salt, cumin powder and garam masala together with gram flour, mix well using your hands to combine the mixture
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Once mixture is combined well together, moisten your hands using the oil and make balls from the mixture (about 4cm diameter). Use the oil to moisten hands as needed
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Deep fry the kofta balls until golden brown, your oil should be on about 175°C, this should take about 3-4 minutes
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Remove the koftas from oil onto a tray and leave to one side
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 To make the sauce: Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add the cumin seeds and once the cumin starts to sizzle add onions and cook for 4-5 minutes until onions are very brown and caramelised
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add ginger and garlic paste and green chilli paste followed by the puréed tomatoes and cook for a few seconds
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add in the turmeric, red chilli powder and salt and mix well
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Cook the masala sauce on a medium heat with the lid on for 4-5 minutes (keep mixing every minute or so)
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Once the oil starts to seep out the edges and the sauce is sizzling, the masala is cooked perfectly, add in the water and bring the gravy to a boil
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add green cardamom powder and double cream to the sauce together with the fenugreek leaves (crushed), garam masala, fresh coriander and anardana powder, cook for 1 minute or so
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Add in the fried kofta balls and shake the pan to coat the balls evenly with the sauce
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Mix well together and cook for a final 2 minutes
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Remove from the heat and garnish with fresh coriander and a swirl of double cream
ecea8c8c-7ae3-4844-9f3a-87f860f6d0a0 Serve with Tilda Pure Basmati Rice and relish. Cook rice as per pack instructions.
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Heat oil in a saucepan, add cumin seeds, cinnamon sticks, black cardamom, peppercorn and cloves. Cook until the spices begin to sizzle
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Add onions and cook for 1-2 minutes
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Add ginger and garlic paste, cook for 2 minutes before adding mixed vegetables and red chilli powder to pan
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Cook the veg for 1 minute or so before adding water, salt and garam masala to the pan and bring to the boil (test the water for seasoning, it should be a little over seasoned as the rice will require this for flavouring)
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Once the water is boiling, drain the soaked rice and add to the pan
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Cook the rice on a medium heat (stirring gently occasionally so the rice grains do not break), this should take 5-7 minutes
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Once the water has almost been soaked up by the rice, completely lower the heat and cover the pilau with two small sheets on foil (inside of the pan) to completely cover the rice and also the top of the pan. Put a lid on the saucepan and steam cook on a low heat for 2 minutes
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Switch off the heat and steam the pilau without any heat for 15 minutes
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Uncover the pilau, lifting the foil and then using a spoon gently lift the rice from 4 sides of the saucepan using a wooden spoon to fluff the rice and shake it so it opens up, each grain should be separate and the rice fluffy and delicious
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Garnish with dried fried onions, pomegranate pearls and fresh coriander
67eebfd6-0ed1-4f85-b722-b39da6f4273c Serve with a raita or plain yoghurt
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Fill a pan with water and place on high heat.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Add ¼ cup salt and bring to a boil.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Add rice and cook for 6-8mins. Once the rice has parboiled, remove from hob and drain.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b While the rice is cooling, add ¾ cup barberries to a pan with a small knob of butter. Allow the barberries to plump up slightly and cook on low-medium heat for about 5 minutes.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b In a separate bowl whisk together egg yolks, yoghurt and crushed saffron.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Add the parboiled rice to the bowl and mix well so all the rice is covered in yoghurt mixture.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Grease a baking dish and add half the amount of rice mixture.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Sprinkle barberries on the top half of the rice (save some to decorate the top too).
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Add remaining half of rice and use and gently pat down the top layer evenly.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Cover the dish with foil and place in oven for 50mins- 1hr.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Remove from oven and flip dish over to remove rice cake on a plate.
c104b14f-06a0-4734-bc6f-851d800a056b Sprinkle barberries and crushed pistachios on top of rice cake to decorate.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Preheat your oven to 200 °C
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Begin by marinating the chicken in tandoori masala. Set aside.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Take a large casserole dish and add in the chicken stock, salt, garlic paste, green chilli, cream and milk. Mix together until everything is well combined
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Add in the Tilda Pure basmati rice and mix again.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b To the top, layer on enough fried onions to cover the dish.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Carefully add the chicken breasts to the top.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Bake in the oven for 1 hour.
3b30db96-cfcc-473f-88dc-d54f37c06a6b Remove from the oven and leave to rest for 5-10mins before eating.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 First make the marinade. Put the onions into a bowl and rub them gently under running cold water. Drain well in a colander, then dry in a salad spinner or with kitchen paper.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Heat the oil in a deep pan. When hot, fry the onions in 3 separate batches until pale golden. Using a slotted spoon, transfer them to a colander, where they will continue to brown in their own heat. The oil can be reused another time if cooled and strained.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Put all but 2 tablespoons of the fried onions into a blender, add the remaining marinade ingredients and whiz to a purée. You might need to do this in batches so that the machine can create a smooth paste and the motor doesn’t overheat. Transfer the mixture to a large flameproof casserole dish.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Trim any excess skin from the chicken pieces, then place the meat in the marinade. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and set aside in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF/Gas Mark 4. Transfer the casserole dish to the oven and cook for about 1 hour, until the chicken is tender.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Meanwhile, cook the potatoes in a pan of boiling salted water for about 8–10 minutes, until tender. Drain and set aside.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Put the measured water into a large saucepan with the bay leaves and some salt and bring to the boil. Add the rice and boil for roughly 6 minutes, until al dente. Drain well, reserving the water to make soup if you wish. Fork through the rice to loosen the grains.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Heat the saffron threads in a warm small frying pan over a gentle heat until they are crisp. Add 2–3 tablespoons of water and set aside to rest for 10 minutes.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Pour the saffron and its liquid over the rice while still in the colander and mix lightly to partially colour the grains.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 When the chicken is ready, the sauce might look too thin or a bit oily, but don’t worry about that. Heat it, uncovered, for a few minutes to reduce it if you wish, but a generous amount of sauce is needed to finish the dish. Taste and adjust the salt if necessary, then add the fresh mint and coriander. Transfer the chicken to a plate and pour the sauce into a jug. Lower the oven temperature to 150ºC/300ºF/Gas Mark 2.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Return some of the sauce to the empty casserole dish and cover with one-third of the rice. Arrange the chicken pieces and a few chunks of potato on top, then cover with another third of the rice. Pour over some more sauce, dot with the remaining potatoes and cover with the remaining rice. Press down gently. Drizzle the remaining sauce over the rice, sprinkle with the reserved onions and the melted butter and cover tightly.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Place on the middle shelf of the oven for up to 40 minutes to heat through fully. If the ingredients have become cold during the process of putting the dish together, they might need longer to heat through. In this case, lower the temperature to 120ºC/250ºF/Gas Mark ½ and continue heating until completely hot.
5f739455-0d1d-49ef-9936-8e7b14b05d04 Serve the biryani with Mixed Raita or a daal, allowing people to help themselves straight from the dish if you like.
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Make the cured egg yolks by mixing the tamari and mirin together in a sealable container. Gently add the egg yolks, cover and place in the fridge for 4–6 hours
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Place the cabbage in a bowl and drizzle over the rice vinegar, sesame oil and maple syrup. Stir to ensure the cabbage is completely coated and set aside to pickle while you prepare the rest of the dish
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Place the brown rice blend into a large saucepan of boiling water set over a medium heat and cook for 25 minutes. Drain well, cover and set aside for 3 minutes
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf While the rice is cooking, make the donburi sauce by adding the soy sauce, mirin, maple syrup, ginger and garlic to a small bowl, stirring to combine
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Pour the olive oil to a large frying pan set over a low heat. Add the chopped onion and cook gently for 5 minutes until soft and translucent
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Turn the heat up to medium and add the chicken pieces. Fry for 5 minutes, stirring regularly, then add the mushrooms. Fry for a further 3 minutes, or until the chicken and mushrooms are cooked
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Add the donburi sauce to the pan and cook for a further 2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and reduced slightly
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Divide the cooked rice & quinoa between four bowls, then add the chicken doburi, pickled cabbage and avocado. Using a spoon, carefully remove the cured egg yolks from the curing liquor and gently place on top of the rice
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf Garnish with chopped spring onions, micro herbs and a sprinkle of black sesame seeds and serve immediately
d89532c2-f2ec-489c-866d-d1dc1efeabbf You can use Tilda Pure Basmati as an alternative.
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Wash the basmati rice in several changes of cold running water until the water runs clear, then place in a bowl and soak for 2 hours in more fresh cold water. If you do not have time to soak the rice for 2 hours, then do soak it for as long as possible – I always see a difference in the length of grain of rice after I soak the rice. In addition to this, the grains are less likely to stick as they have absorbed water while soaking and therefore cook faster
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 When ready to cook, drain the soaked basmati rice and set aside. In a heavy-based pan that has a lid, heat 1 tablespoon of the ghee over a medium-high heat
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 When the ghee is hot, add the cardamom pods, cassia bark, cloves and bay leaf to the pan. After a few seconds, when the spices begin to sizzle and pop, using a slotted spoon, remove them from the pan to a plate and set aside
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Using the same pan the spices were fried in, fry the cashew nuts and stir until lightly brown, then remove with a slotted spoon. Lower the heat and add the raisins (you need to be quick as you do not want them to burst; remove them the moment they start to swell up)
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Finally add the onion to the pan and fry gently, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and caramelized. Using a slotted spoon, remove the onion from the pan and place on a plate to drain. Spread the onions across the plate so they crisp as they cool
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Put the kettle on to boil. Add the soaked, drained basmati rice to the pan with the remainder of the ghee. Add the fried spices, bay leaf and half the caramelised onions. Stir for 1 minute to coat the rice in the ghee and spice mixture, then add the salt and cover the rice with 600ml boiling water from the kettle
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Cook, uncovered, over a medium-high heat until the water has been almost absorbed by the rice (about 4 minutes)
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Once most of the water has been absorbed, cover the pan with a lid, lower the heat and simmer for a further 5 minutes. Once the rice is cooked, add the fried cashew nuts and raisins and gently mix using a fork to lift and separate the grains
361b3e92-a57e-4b41-bba0-79cf927e5a01 Cover again and leave for a further 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with the remaining browned onions and raisins
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Put the star anise, coriander, cloves, peppercorns, cumin, cardamom, fennel and cinnamon stick into a spice grinder, food processor or pestle and mortar to grind them, and then set the spice mix to one side.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Rinse your basmati rice in at least three changes of water to wash out the starch and leave to soak in a bowl of cold water on one side for 30 mins. Next, chop your onions in half, peel them and then slice into fine rings. Pop the ginger and garlic into a food processor, or finely grate the ginger and crush the garlic.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Put a tablespoon of oil into a large, heavy-bottomed, lidded frying pan on a high heat. When you are sure that the pan is very hot, sear the lamb in batches (so that you don’t crowd the pan), turning them until they are golden brown. Take the meat out with a slotted spoon and set aside.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Add another 2 tablespoons of oil to the same pan and fry the onions for 8 to 10 minutes, until they are soft and golden. Take out half of the onions, transfer them to a bowl and set to one side. Then put the garlic and ginger into the pan. Stir-fry for a couple of minutes and add the spices that you have ground, together with the turmeric and chilli powder. Keep stirring to ensure these don’t burn at the bottom of the pan.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 After a minute or so, add the lamb, yoghurt and tomato tin blitzed, stir well to ensure it is all mixed together, and add 400ml of warm water. Bring to the boil, then turn the heat down to low, pop the lid on and leave to simmer for around 1½ hours, or until lamb is tender.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/gas 4.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Meanwhile, you’ll need to cook the rice and prepare the fried onions for layering. Drain the rice and transfer to a saucepan. Boil a large pan of water add the rice so that there is 4 times as much water as the rice, and bring to the boil. Boil for 8 minutes, until it’s just cooked but still has a bite. Drain and set aside.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Transfer the onions from the bowl to a small frying pan and continue to fry for another 10 minutes, or until the onions are caramelized, then take off the heat. Check on the lamb: as soon as it is falling apart, season with salt to taste and take off the heat. Seal the pot with a tight lid or foil.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Take an ovenproof pot which will snugly accommodate the rice and lamb, such as a casserole dish. Remove half of the meat from the lamb curry using a slotted spoon (to leave the sauce behind) and place it at the bottom of the pot. Top the meat with half of the rice and half of the onions and repeat with the rest of the meat, rice and onions. Keep the sauce of the curry aside to serve with the biryani. Bake the biryani for 20 mins.
5c24ff84-b7a9-4727-a833-05649b7c2426 Sprinkle the rice with the rose water, saffron, Toasted cashews and sliced pistachio.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab Mix the saffron threads into a 4 tsps of hot water, Set aside.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab Soak the rice for 30 minutes in cold water. Rinse the rice thoroughly when you drain it and set aside.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab Melt the butter in a large skillet and saute the fennel and cumin seeds until they are fragrant, just a minute or two. Add the cinnamon, cardamom and allspice and stir to combine. Add the onion and saute over low heat until the onion is softened, about 10 minutes.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab Add in the rice and saute it for a minute or 2 with the spices and onion.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab To 1 litre of water add the bay leaves and lemon rind. Stir to combine, season with salt and fresh cracked black pepper.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab Add in the fruit and nuts, stir to combine, and cover the skillet with a tight fitting lid. Cook on low to medium heat for about 8 minutes, then turn off the heat and let it sit, covered to let it steam dry. Add the saffron water in swirls and let this sit for another 10 minutes.
9e49b8c7-5547-484d-b4d1-9c1515bb6eab When the rice is done, fluff it, remove the bay leaves, and spoon onto a large platter. Scatter the pomegranate seeds on top to garnish.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Rinse your basmati rice in at least three changes of water to wash out the starch and leave to soak in a bowl of cold water on one side for 30 mins.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Next, chop your onions in half, peel them and then slice into fine rings and dry them off in a tablespoon of oil until golden brown and set aside.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Heat a non-stick pan. Add the remaining green cardamoms, cloves, black cardamom and cinnamon along with bay leaf and caraway seeds and roast. Add onions, carrot, French beans, cauliflower florets and green peas.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Sprinkle salt, cover and cook on medium heat for two minutes. Add ginger-garlic paste mixed with a little water and stir. Cover and cook for two minutes. Add turmeric powder, red chilli powder and coriander powder and cook. Whisk yogurt with rose water and saffron. Add a little water or milk and whisk well. Add tomato puree to the vegetables along with half teaspoon Garam masala powder and mix well. Simmer for two minutes.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/gas 4.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Meanwhile, in a separate pan you need to cook the rice and prepare the fried onions for layering. Drain the rice and transfer to a saucepan. Pour enough cold water over the rice so that it is covered by 2cm, and bring to the boil. Boil for 8 minutes, until it’s just cooked but still has a bite. Drain and set aside.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Take an ovenproof pot which will snugly accommodate the rice and veg curry, such as a casserole dish. Remove half of the veg from the veg curry using a slotted spoon (to leave the sauce behind) and place it at the bottom of the pot. Add a little of chopped mint and coriander at each layer. Top the veg with half of the rice and half of the onions and repeat with the rest of the veg, rice and onions. Keep the sauce of the curry aside to serve with the biryani. Bake the biryani for 20 mins.
578e8e14-1249-43e5-b929-cdbd13d708e9 Sprinkle the rice with the rose water, saffron, Toasted cashews and sliced pistachio.
b62ee26f-ef0a-45dd-91ac-ea041248206a To begin, toast the cumin and coriander seeds in a dry pan then grind them with the cardamom in a pestle and mortar or spice grinder
b62ee26f-ef0a-45dd-91ac-ea041248206a In a wide heavy-based pan, soften the onions in some olive oil, then add the ras el hanout and other ground spices to the pan. Cook out for a couple of minutes, stirring so they don't burn
b62ee26f-ef0a-45dd-91ac-ea041248206a Remove the onions from the pan, turn up the heat and add the lamb, stirring occasionally until browned all over. Once browned, reduce the heat, add the stock and 500ml water and pop the onions back into the pan. Cook with a lid on over a very low heat for an hour
b62ee26f-ef0a-45dd-91ac-ea041248206a Add the rice, dried cherries, some salt and pepper, and another 250ml of boiling water and cook for another 40–45 minutes, or until the rice is cooked
b62ee26f-ef0a-45dd-91ac-ea041248206a When the rice is almost ready, place the spinach in the pan on top of the tagine and put the lid back on to wilt the spinach for a minute. Once wilted, stir it into the dish. Finally, stir in the tarragon and serve
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b To begin, make the marinade. Finely mince the garlic and coriander stems. Dissolve the sugar in the warm water, then combine all the ingredients for the marinade in a bowl, stirring to mix well. Rub all over the chicken and let the chicken sit in the marinade in a large ziplock bag overnight. Turn the bag occasionally so that all sides stay coated with the marinade
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b On the day of cooking, preheat the oven to 160°C/gas mark 3
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b Take the chicken out of the fridge and let it come back up to room temperature. Pat with paper towels to remove the marinade and place on a roasting tray
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b Drizzle lightly with oil, place on the oven’s middle rack and roast for 2 hours, basting it regularly with its own juices. Turn the oven up to 220°C/gas mark 8 and let the chicken cook for another 15–20 minutes, or until golden brown
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b While the chicken is in the oven, prepare the other elements of the dish. Wash and drain the rice. Cover with cold water and leave to soak. Blitz all the ingredients for the green sauce together, adding just enough oil to make a smooth runny sauce, sort of like a pesto. Season to taste with salt. Keep the sauce covered in the refrigerator so it doesn’t lose its vibrant green
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b When the chicken is ready, remove it from the oven, lifting it from the tin onto a chopping board, and cover loosely with a foil tent
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b While the chicken is resting, drain and tip the rice into a rice cooker. Pour the chicken roasting juices into a measuring jug and top up with enough water so you have 300ml liquid altogether. Add to the rice and let the rice cooker do its magic
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b For those without a rice cooker, bring the rice and roast chicken juices to a boil in a saucepan, then cover and turn the heat down to the lowest setting. Let the rice cook, undisturbed, for about 10–15 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Turn the heat off, give the rice a stir, and put the lid back on, letting it finish cooking by steaming in the pan’s residual heat, for another 5 minutes
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b When ready to serve, carve and chop the chicken into generous bite-sized pieces before serving with the fragrant rice and green sauce
c6ca188f-8f60-4b3f-b894-946c47e4a99b You can use Tilda Pure Basmati Rice as an alternative.
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c To begin, lightly dust the duck breasts with the Thai 7-Spice and leave to marinate for an hour in the fridge
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c Meanwhile, make the curry paste by simply placing all the ingredients (apart from the coriander leaves) in a blender. Blitz to a rough and ready paste. Place in a bowl or jar and cover (you may have some left over, so a jar might be preferable
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c For the crispy shallots, pour the oil into a saucepan and place over a high heat. When the hot is oil (not smoking though) throw in the shallot rounds. They will bubble up immediately and the key here is to keep a close eye on proceedings. As they bubble, the water will evaporate and the bubbling will slowly begin to die down after about 8 minutes or so, when the shallots will begin to become golden and crisp. Don’t let them go too far, or they will burn. Scoop out with a slotted spoon and allow to drain and cool on kitchen paper. These can now be stored in an airtight container
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c Remove the duck breasts from the fridge and allow to come up to room temperature
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c Preheat the oven to 180°C/gas mark 4Place the duck breasts skin-side down in a cold frying pan then place over a medium to high heat. This method helps to slowly render the fat out of the duck, crisping up the skin beautifully. After 5 minutes, flip the breasts and place in the oven to finish cooking – 10–12 minutes is good for medium, 15 minutes for well done. Once the duck breasts are ready, leave to rest in a warm spot for another 10 minutes
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c While the duck is cooking, prepare the rice by heating a wide saucepan or wok on the hob over a high heat. Add a generous splash of oil and then 4 tablespoons of the red curry paste. Or a bit more if you like things spicy. Less if you don’t. Stir briskly for a good couple of minutes, to cook the paste out
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c Add the rice and stir to toast for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and 100ml of water and cover with a lid. Cook until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, then stir through the white parts of the spring onions. Remove from the heat and stir through the diced mango
38f2cd87-4ef9-45f5-b578-30412c6a865c To serve, slice the rested duck breasts evenly. Divide the rice between plates, place the duck breasts on top and garnish with the crispy shallots. Chop some of the reserved coriander leaves, sprinkle over and serve
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef For the salted caramel sauce, heat the granulated sugar in a sauce pan over a medium heat, stirring constantly with a rubber spatula.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef The sugar will form clumps and eventually melt into a thick brown, amber coloured liquid as you continue to stir. Be careful not to burn.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Once the sugar has completely melted, immediately add the butter. Be careful as the caramel will bubble rapidly when the butter is added.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Stir until the butter has completely melted (approx. 2-3 mins).
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Very slowly drizzle in the cream while stirring – the mixture will bubble when the cream is added.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Allow the mixture to boil for one minute.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Remove from the heat and stir in the salt.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Allow to cool before using.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef For the Rice Pudding, place the rice in a large saucepan with 200ml cold water. Bring to the boil, reduce to a low heat, cover and simmer very gently for 12 minutes or until the water has absorbed.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Pour the milk into a separate saucepan, scrape the seeds from the vanilla pod and add along with the sugar. Heat to simmering point over a low heat.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Once the rice has absorbed all 200ml water add to the milk mixture, rise to a medium heat for 12-15 minutes, until the rice is tender and the milk has thickened.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef In a small bowl beat together the egg yolk and cream, pour into the rice mixture slowly stirring throughout, reduce to a low heat for a further 6-8 minutes.
07e311a8-1448-4e0c-87cf-343075ec4bef Take the pan off the heat, spoon into individual dessert bowls or glasses and finish with the salted caramel sauce.
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Mix the avocado and guacamole together with a squeeze of lemon juice
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Press into the bottom of a tall ring mould about 6cm in diameter
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Follow with a layer of the Tilda Super Grains Lime & Herb, pressing down well
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Mix together the tomatoes and coriander and season with salt and pepper
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Add to ring mould and press down well on top of the grains
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Mix together the cream cheese, sour cream and Mexican seasonings if using
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Gently add to the layer of tomatoes
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Leave to chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or longer if you have time
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Carefully lift the ring mould off
68742c61-d3bb-4372-bdd0-d694a998912d Garnish each with a couple of basil leaves
79e389c4-324c-4ef6-8b23-08e1480a421a Fry the onions in pan and add a sprinkle of baharat and sumac
79e389c4-324c-4ef6-8b23-08e1480a421a Add courgettes and aubergines with some water
79e389c4-324c-4ef6-8b23-08e1480a421a Add in chickpeas, vegetable stock, apricots, black pepper and stir well
79e389c4-324c-4ef6-8b23-08e1480a421a Add rice and tofu
79e389c4-324c-4ef6-8b23-08e1480a421a Leave to simmer and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add lemon to finish
0e0a502f-8f31-4fa2-a394-3395ac201dd5 Chop up the apricots, mint leaves, fennel, peeled carrots and add to a bowl
0e0a502f-8f31-4fa2-a394-3395ac201dd5 Peel the orange and cut into small chunks, add to bowl
180f09d1-c273-4e1b-b229-16ccefef4d65 Fry the onions with some baharat spice
180f09d1-c273-4e1b-b229-16ccefef4d65 Add the chickpeas and prawns
180f09d1-c273-4e1b-b229-16ccefef4d65 In a bowl, mix some chopped fennel, orange, sumac, mint and orange segments
180f09d1-c273-4e1b-b229-16ccefef4d65 Add in the prawns
180f09d1-c273-4e1b-b229-16ccefef4d65 Stir in the rice and serve
b5ece220-0875-46bf-9e1d-b5adf5083ac8 Fry the mushrooms in a pan with peppers, red onion and green beans
b5ece220-0875-46bf-9e1d-b5adf5083ac8 Whilst that's cooking, make a salsa: tomato, avocado, spring onions and coriander
b5ece220-0875-46bf-9e1d-b5adf5083ac8 Add rice to mushrooms and in a separate pan, fry the prawns
b5ece220-0875-46bf-9e1d-b5adf5083ac8 Add prawns to rice and vegetables and combine together
b5ece220-0875-46bf-9e1d-b5adf5083ac8 Garnish with coriander and dill
f2821ea4-666f-42de-a013-0c876fa204a5 Chop all veg finely and slice the avocado. Saute the onion, chilli, & garlic
7d1c8c11-63a1-4bd0-9d37-ada5e0729f19 Heat the oil in a large pan with a lid. Add the onion and coriander stalks, cook gently for 8-10 mins
7d1c8c11-63a1-4bd0-9d37-ada5e0729f19 Add the garlic, ginger, green chillies and turmeric and cook for another 2 mins
7d1c8c11-63a1-4bd0-9d37-ada5e0729f19 Pour in the coconut milk, bring to the boil. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper; add the cardamom, cloves, lime leaves and cinnamon. Simmer for 3-4 mins until thickened
7d1c8c11-63a1-4bd0-9d37-ada5e0729f19 Add the prawns and cook for 3-4 mins. Cover the pan, remove from heat and set aside for about 5 minutes – the prawns will continue to cook. Ensure they are fully cooked before serving
7d1c8c11-63a1-4bd0-9d37-ada5e0729f19 Cook the rice according to pack instructions and serve with the curry, garnished with the coriander leaves
64d7998a-55fa-45b9-856d-4b44cc37e16c Blanch the butternut squash and sweet potato for 5 minutes, drain and put to one side
64d7998a-55fa-45b9-856d-4b44cc37e16c Make a paste using the roughly chopped onion, garlic, red chilli, ginger, 1 tablespoon oil and the garam masala
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Fry all of the masala ingredients together until soft in a large pan
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Add the diced lamb and cook until sealed
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 In a separate pan heat the remaining oil, add the whole spices and heat for a few minutes
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Add the rice and stir to coat with the spice mix
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Add the water and salt then combine with the lamb mix, potatoes, and green beans.
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Transfer to a large oven proof casserole
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Cook at 180deg fan oven for 50 minutes stirring at regular intervals
f30af691-e7b7-4ed7-96d1-d3c26ede27c8 Garnish with chopped coriander to serve
c4d2ae0f-70e3-412d-bb85-e9d70ed7f722 Make the curry paste by placing the garlic, shallots, ginger, lemongrass, chilies, cumin, half of the coriander into a food processor and blitzing until finely chopped
c4d2ae0f-70e3-412d-bb85-e9d70ed7f722 Add the lime juice and blitz again
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Gently heat 1 tbsp oil in a large pan. Add the onion, ginger, garlic and chilli.
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Season and cook over a low heat for 4-5 minutes to soften. Add the flour and spices and stir well
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Remove from the heat and blitz to a paste in a blender or food processor. Return to the heat and add the stock, stirring continuously. Set to one side
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Add the remaining oil to a new pan and cook the chicken on a high heat, turning to seal the edges. Pour over the sauce, bring to the boil, cover, reduce to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes until the sauce has thickened and the chicken is cooked through. Add more water if needed during cooking
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Cook the rice according to pack instruction
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Add the pak choi to the chicken 5 minutes before the end
5009de20-4e8f-4403-9305-e74537e7441b Serve with the rice and sprinkled with the cashew nuts
5be69099-3ccd-4b91-96fc-3661d345082f Blanch the rice in a large pan of boiling water for 2 minutes then drain.
5be69099-3ccd-4b91-96fc-3661d345082f Heat the oven to 150 C/Gas mark 3. Grease and line a 25cm round deep cake tin.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Toast the coconut in a pan over a low heat, stirring until it turns golden brown
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Remove the coconut to a plate and into the same pan add the cinnamon sticks, dried chillies, peppercorns, star anise and fennel seeds. Roast in the pan for 3-4 minutes then add the ground coriander and chilli powder and stir for a minute. Add 100ml of water to form a paste and cook for 2 minutes.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Remove the cinnamon sticks, star anise and whole chillies and keep for later. Add the toasted coconut, turmeric and salt to the pan. Add everything to a spice grinder or pestle and mortar and grind to a smooth paste.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Heat the oil in the same pan and slowly cook the onions until they are soft – this will take about 10 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for a couple of minutes then turn up the heat and add the curry leaves and stir for a minute.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Add the tomatoes and the spice paste, return the cinnamon stick, star anise and chillie to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring until you end up with a smooth paste and the oil starts to separate out.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Remove half the mixture and freeze or place in an airtight container which will keep in the fridge for a week or so.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Add the chicken and cook, covered, for 10 minutes. Add 200ml chicken stock remove the lid and cook for a further 5-10 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
20b50221-6b4b-4745-b255-d46ba22b48c0 Remove the star anise, cinnamon and chilli, stir through the lemon juice and green chilli (if using) and scatter with the fresh coriander.
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Sift the cornflour and plain flour together in a large bowl
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Make a well in the centre and add the egg and water
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Whisk to combine, do not overmix
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Heat oil for frying in a large heavy bottomed pan,(test with a piece of bread until becomes golden when dropped in).Caution :Do not leave unattended, hot oil can be dangerous)
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Dust the prawns lightly with seasoned flour
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Dip into the batter and place carefully into the hot oil
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Deep fry for 2-3 minutes, until golden and crisp
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Remove with slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper
10234c04-c537-4fe4-b161-71797123344e Heat the rice according to pack instruction and serve with the prawns and sauce of your choice
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d To prepare the rice, add the basmati to a pan of cold water and allow to soak for 5 minutes. Drain carefully, then top up with more cold water to cover. Give the pan a swirl to rinse the grains before carefully draining again. Repeat this process a couple more times to fully wash the rice.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d Pre heat the oven to 220C/gas mark 6.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d In a large ovenproof pan, add the butter and allow to melt over a gentle heat. Add the chopped shallots and sweat down until softened, then stir in the pistachios, cranberries and thyme. Cook for 2 minutes before adding the washed rice and miixing together until evenly coated in butter.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d Stir in the stock and increase the heat to high. Allow the stock to come to the boil before adding a little salt to season and covering the pan with a fitted lid. Transfer the pan to the oven and cook for 15 minutes.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d Once cooked, remove from the oven and allow the rice to sit and steam for 5-10 minutes with the lid still on.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d While the rice steams, heat a griddle pan with a little oil over a high heat and add the turkey steaks. Fry for 2 minutes, then turn over and fry for a further 2 minutes on the other side.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d Add the butter and baste the steaks for a few more minutes, before taking off the heat and leaving to rest for 2 minutes.
5eb05675-a96b-4a0c-b56d-9b00784d7a3d Fluff up the pilaf with a fork before serving, dividing the rice between plates and topping with the sliced turkey and a garnish of parsley cress.
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Preheat oven to 180°C.
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Seal shanks with onions, thyme, bay, and cinnamon on a medium to high heat. Add 3 cloves of garlic (whole) and cook for 10 minutes.
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Add wine and reduce for 2 minutes then add 1/2 the stock, cover and place in the oven to cook for 1 hour.
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Meanwhile soak rice for 1 hour and add to dish with remaining stock and cook for 40 minutes covered
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Heat the redcurrant jelly and mustard with a couple of tablespoons of water in a saucepan.
fac87a27-7f3d-4070-9cbb-25a5f10c92be Scatter with fresh parsley, mint and season as required. Pour over the redcurrant and mustard mixture and serve!
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Preheat the oven to 200°C/Gas mark 6.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Heat the oil in a flameproof casserole dish, add the onion and cook for 5 minutes over a medium heat until softened.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Add the garlic, turmeric, ras el hanout and coriander stalks and cook, stirring, for a couple of minutes.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Add the turkey, butternut squash, chickpeas and halved apricots to the casserole, then pour over the tomatoes and stock.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Season well with salt and pepper and bring to the boil. Put the lid on and transfer to the oven.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 After 30 minutes, turn down the over to 150°C/Gas mark 4, stir the tagine and return to the oven, uncovered, for a further 30 minutes.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Meanwhile empty the almonds onto a baking tray and bake for 6-8 minutes until golden, then finely slice.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Taste and adjust the seasoning.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Stir in the almonds and pomegranate seeds then sprinkle over the lemon zest and coriander leaves.
99e04574-a7de-440c-adfc-8bec4dfd3556 Serve with Tilda Wholegrain Basmati Rice and yoghurt.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f For the rice stage, rinse the rice three times in cold water and drain well
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Place the ﬁsh stock in a large saucepan, bring to the boil and add the bay leaves, turmeric and mixed herbs
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the rice, cover, and cook over a very low heat for 16 minutes, stirring occasionally.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the frozen peas and cook for a further 4 minutes, until the stock is absorbed and the rice is cooked. Remove the bay leaves.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Meanwhile, for the chicken and prawn stage, heat the oil in a paella pan or large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the onion, garlic and chilli ﬂakes and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the red pepper and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes, then add the chicken and stir-fry for a further 6-7 minutes.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Stir in the prawns (and mussels and scallops if using and heat through gently for 4-5 minutes. Ensure the scallops are thoroughly cooked.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the seafood mixture to the rice and stir gently to combine.
170fd161-3507-4af1-98c2-922f48f1a56f Add the lemon juice and serve immediately.
792f8ded-33d4-452b-a46b-b09da634d379 Place the rice in a large saucepan with 200ml cold water. Bring to the boil, reduce heat to low, then cover and simmer very gently for 12 minutes or until the water is absorbed.
792f8ded-33d4-452b-a46b-b09da634d379 Pour the milk into a separate saucepan and add the cardamom pod. Scrape the vanilla seeds into the milk with a sharp knife. Heat to simmering point over a low heat and pour over the rice. Add the sugar and cook over a medium heat for 12-15 minutes, until the rice is tender and the milk has thickened.
792f8ded-33d4-452b-a46b-b09da634d379 In a small bowl, beat together the egg yolk, cream and lemon zest. Stir in a large spoonful of the rice mixture, mix well, then add to the remaining rice mixture. Cook over a low heat for 6-8 minutes, stirring all the time, until the pudding is thick and creamy.
792f8ded-33d4-452b-a46b-b09da634d379 Take the pan off the heat, remove the cardamom pod and stir in the butter. Spoon into individual dessert bowls or glasses, garnish with the extra lemon zest and serve warm with chocolate biscuits if desired.
043429d0-c5e8-48dd-b070-209b89ec4e6a Boil the rice in a large saucepan with the coconut milk and stock for 15-20 minutes, uncovered, stirring occasionally.
043429d0-c5e8-48dd-b070-209b89ec4e6a Meanwhile, in another pan cook the cauliflower in boiling water for 5 minutes, drain.
043429d0-c5e8-48dd-b070-209b89ec4e6a Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry 1 tsp mustard seeds, until they pop, add the onion and chilli flakes and continue to fry for 3-4 minutes. Add the curry powder, cauliflower, peas and 50ml water and fry for 2-3 minutes. Season to taste.
043429d0-c5e8-48dd-b070-209b89ec4e6a Stir the almonds, sultanas, coriander and remaining mustard seeds into the rice, and serve with the spicy cauliflower
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 Add the rice to a heavy-bottomed pan with the milk, vanilla, zest and sugar. Grate in a little fresh nutmeg and add a pinch of cinnamon (adding more or less to taste) and stir to combine. Place over a gentle heat and allow to simmer gently for 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 Taking the pan off the heat, add in the white chocolate and stir until melted through the rice. Squeeze out the excess water from the gelatin leaves and mix into the pan so that they dissolve into the rice
