f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 Leave the rice to cool until it reaches 30°C, then gently fold through the whipped cream. Distribute the mixture between ten 6cm round moulds or ramekins and chill for a minimum of 4 hours
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 While the parfaits chill, make the stock syrup which will be used for poaching the fruits. Add the water and sugar to a large pan, stir together then bring to the boil. Once the sugar has fully dissolved, remove from the heat and allow to cool
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 Poaching the fruit separately will help maintain their unique flavours. Add the prunes to one pan with 250ml of the stock syrup (or to just cover the prunes) and the tea bag, then simmer until soft. Chill in the fridge until needed
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 In another pan, add the apricots, another 250ml of stock syrup and the split vanilla pod. Simmer until soft, then reserve in the fridge
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 For the figs, add them to a pan with 250ml of the stock syrup and the fresh thyme, simmering until tender before chilling until needed
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 Add the pears to a pan with any remaining stock syrup, the sweet wine, cloves and cinnamon stick. Simmer until softened, then allow to cool in the poaching liquor. Dice into 5mm cubes and chill until needed
f67ecfd9-55cd-49d9-98ea-9d4755a46ac2 To serve, carefully turn the parfaits out from the moulds on to serving plates. Dust liberally with icing sugar and use a blowtorch to caramelise this slightly. Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint and serve alongside the poached fruits
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Rinse the rice three times in cold water and drain well.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Place the chicken stock in a large saucepan, bring to the boil and add the remaining rice ingredients.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Add the rice, cover, and cook over a very low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally until the stock is absorbed and the rice is cooked. Remove the bay leaves.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over a high heat. Add the turkey and Cajun spice mix and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Add the onion and stir-fry for a further 3-4 minutes, then turn down the heat to low and add the peppers, celery, spring onions and garlic and stir-fry gently for 4-5 minutes.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Add the tomatoes and parsley to the meat and vegetables in the pan. Stir to combine, then mix gently into the cooked rice.
8191c5bd-2cc1-465d-ab10-01688a12ff07 Season to taste and serve immediately with a crisp, green salad.
5ccf56a8-3fd2-407b-9d64-42161d7c561d Rinse the rice is cold water until the water runs clears – set aside in a sieve to allow as much water as possible to drain off.
bf224352-328e-46ab-bcb3-d5bce29990e7 Cook the rice for 10mins, drain and cool immediately
bf224352-328e-46ab-bcb3-d5bce29990e7 Scramble the eggs with the stir fry oil in a pan, season well and keep to one side
4606fa51-232e-4151-a7e4-32f6965d7ded Score the skin of the duck breast
4606fa51-232e-4151-a7e4-32f6965d7ded Combine the remaining ingredients except for the spring onions to make a marinade
4606fa51-232e-4151-a7e4-32f6965d7ded Combine with the duck breasts and leave to marinade in the fridge for 2-3 hours or overnight if time allows
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Preheat an oven to 160°c, Gas mark 3
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Roughly chop or crush the nuts with the back of a knife
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Bring the water to the boil and add 180g of the sugar. Continue to boil until the syrup reaches a nutty brown colour
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Take from the heat, add the nuts and salt and spread a thin layer over a sheet of greaseproof paper. Leave to cool
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Bring the milk, vanilla essence, rice and the remaining sugar to the boil. Turn down to a simmer and cook until all the milk has been absorbed. Leave to cool slightly
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Whisk the egg yolks and cream together and then add to the rice mixture
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Divide the mixture between 8 ramekins and cook in a water bath in the oven for about 30 minutes or until firm to the touch
5e065fa7-41cb-4b43-8e94-4099b5d24c14 Leave brulees to cool right down and then sprinkle with crushed praline or decorate with shards of broken praline
59f85c74-ab4c-47e2-8e25-5050c7ac7a7b Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the garlic and shallots and fry gently until soft for 3 -5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and paprika and cook for a further 2-3 minutes
59f85c74-ab4c-47e2-8e25-5050c7ac7a7b Add the stock or wine and heat for a minutes. Add the spinach, mushroom ketchup and crème fraiche. Simmer for a few minutes to reduce
59f85c74-ab4c-47e2-8e25-5050c7ac7a7b Heat the Tilda Wholegrain & Wild Steamed Basmati in the microwave
59f85c74-ab4c-47e2-8e25-5050c7ac7a7b Add the parsley to the Mushroom Stroganoff. Season with salt and pepper and serve on a bed of the rice.
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Preheat oven to 180°c, Gas Mark 6
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Place the chicken, breast side down, and starting at the thigh end make a cut right through the chicken. Turn the chicken over and press down firmly to open the chicken up. Place in an ovenproof dish
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Mix together all the marinade ingredients and spread over the chicken
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Cook in the oven for about 1 hour 15mins until the juices run clear. Leave to rest for 10 minutes
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Meanwhile make the Asparagus and Coconut Rice. Blanch the Asparagus Tips in boiling water for about 3 mins and cool immediately in cold water.
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 In a large frying pan or wok heat the coconut oil. Add the spinach and heat through until wilted
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Heat the Tilda Coconut Steamed Basmati Rice in the microwave and stir into the pan
5bd7676d-aaa7-4660-a021-cc3299391064 Add the asparagus and a squeeze of lemon juice Serve with slices of the Lemon & Chili Chicken
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Preheat oven to 180°c, gas mark 6.
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the garlic, shallots and fennel and fry gently until soft for about 3-5 minutes.
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Add the stock or wine, passatta and red pepper. Fry for about 5 minutes.
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Add the fish and seafood mix and transfer to an ovenproof dish or tagine. Lay the clams on top. Season to taste.
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Cover and cook for about 20 minutes or until the clam shells have opened.
5e6a8c1c-bdb8-457a-879f-38481847713d Serve with heated Tilda Lemon & Herb rice.
f9443b75-32ea-43ca-8430-c4c5c93a9304 In a pot boiling with boiling water add the Brown Basmati & Wild Rice and simmer for 25 minutes and then drain. Whilst this is cooking
f9443b75-32ea-43ca-8430-c4c5c93a9304 Roast 100g of the beetroot with honey in a hot oven for 20 minutes. Leave to cool and then chop roughly
8ee334df-31cb-4b09-bcb7-f0ded6f30879 Make the minted pea puree by blitzing together 100g of the peas and the mint until smooth
c03c5835-6796-41e9-95b4-b4c61d6661a3 Soak the dried mushrooms in 150g hot water for 10 minutes
c03c5835-6796-41e9-95b4-b4c61d6661a3 Drain and squeeze the water from the mushrooms. Reserve the liquor
1e2c3b1e-d6dc-4500-b562-98f59fc9e0a2 To toast almonds, add dry to a pan and gently heat, keeping the flakes moving to prevent burning.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 If using raw chickpeas, please soak them in adequate water in a deep bowl or pan over night or a minimum of six hours at least. The longer they are soaked the more they will swell and cook faster. However prolonged soaking will ferment and thereby spoil the chickpeas. Boil them in the same water adding more if required with a little salt until tender. Set aside.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Heat the oil in a deep pot or pan, which has a tight fitting lid.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 When the oil forms a haze add the cinnamon bark, cloves & red chilli. As soon as you see the cloves swell add the cumin and sauté for a minute or so.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Add the garlic & a half-minute later the onions and sauté until the garlic is almost on the point of browning.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Now lower the heat & add the rice, the salt and stir for a minute or two, turning well and levelling out each time so that the rice gets an all round heat.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Add how water or stock up to maybe 3/4th of an inch or 2cms above the height of the rice. This is if you feel you are comfortable not using one and half times.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 This is simpler and works very well.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Stir for a few seconds and allow to rest covered.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Put the heat to a minimum.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Stir again every minute or so until most of the water is absorbed and you can detect water along the sides but not in plentiful.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Add either canned chickpeas drained or boiled chickpeas also drained. You may like to use the water along with the water when first adding to the rice. This will add a lot more flavour but it only discolours the pulao.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 After each stir cover the pot but ensure that all the sides are clean of grains when you are about to cover.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Check every one or two minutes, give the rice a gentle stir from the bottom up but very gently.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 Check your seasoning and whether or not the rice is cooked. Approximately 30-40 minutes on a slow fire is often adequate.
7ff32cc4-3ae0-498d-9b25-469fab722372 When serving, top with browned onions and sprinkle some freshly chopped coriander.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 Rinse and soak the rice and beans together in some water for about 30 minutes. Drain well.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 Preheat the oven to 140°C/275°F/Gas Mark 1.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 Over a medium heat, warm the oil or ghee in a casserole dish that has a lid and that can be placed in the oven. Once the oil is hot, add the cumin seeds and in 30 seconds, once they change colour slightly, add the ginger, garlic and green chilli and sauté until the garlic changes colour, about 2 minutes. Add the onion and sauté well until the onion turns pale, about 3–4 minutes, then add the chopped tomato and the turmeric. Sauté until the tomato turns to pulp and almost dries out, about 8–10 minutes, then add the water and salt.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 When the water comes to a boil, add the rice and daal mix and stir regularly until the water starts to be absorbed. When this happens, clean down the sides of the dish with a flat spatula, add some seasoning, cover the dish and place in the oven.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 Let cook for 10–12 minutes, then turn off the oven and leave the dish inside for another 30 minutes or so. Remove, stir gently and check the seasoning. Sometimes, depending on the rice, the khichdi can become dry and lumpy. If this has happened, add some water and stir to get a porridge-like consistency.
4c565600-7076-4704-8e3d-3bf996422fa5 Sprinkle with some coriander, if you like, and serve.
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Cook the rice according to the packet instructions. Once cooked, drain the rice and set aside to steam-dry
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f While the rice cooks, heat 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in a medium to large saucepan over a moderate heat. Once hot, add the diced onion and finely chopped celery and sweat for 8 minutes until they have softened, become translucent and started to slightly caramelise
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Add the garlic, ginger and chilli and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the sliced carrot and continue to stir-fry for 5 minutes
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Meanwhile, drain the silken tofu in a sieve or a colander
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f After 5 minutes, add the peas and baby corn and stir well. Stir-fry for 4 minutes to heat through
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Add the cooked and drained rice, stir well to combine and then make a well in the centre of the saucepan. Turn the heat up high and add your tofu to the well – it should sizzle immediately. Sprinkle the turmeric and the kala namak over the tofu
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Hold your nerve here with the heat; after two minutes start to stir and break up the tofu and incorporate this into the rice and veggies. Continue to stir-fry the fried rice for 6 minutes, or longer if you prefer it drier and crispier
b920fe18-bf20-422d-84f3-202f9fad5a6f Serve in warmed bowls, sprinkled with sliced spring onions, fresh lime wedges or a squeeze of lime juice, toasted sesame seeds and 2 tablespoons of kimchi per bowl
43a0e1da-6472-4af8-bbf1-cc3966b26212 Dice the mixed peppers and slice the onions. Cut the feta into small cubes.
43a0e1da-6472-4af8-bbf1-cc3966b26212 Heat Tilda Pure Basmati rice according to pouch instructions and place into a serving bowl.
43a0e1da-6472-4af8-bbf1-cc3966b26212 Mix in the olives, peppers, onions and feta, as well as the spice mix, herbs and chickpeas.
43a0e1da-6472-4af8-bbf1-cc3966b26212 Squeeze over the lemon before serving.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b Place the spices, crushed chillies and sea salt in a small bowl and combine.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b Put the chicken breasts in a large freezer bag along with the spice mix, garlic, lime juice and 1 tsp of olive oil. Seal the bag then shake and rub to combine the meat and spices (you can do this anytime you like before and keep in the fridge).
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b To make the salsa, place the mango, tomatoes, coriander, lime juice, chilli and sea salt in a medium-sized bowl and combine then place in the fridge to keep cool.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b Place the freezer bag on a firm surface and bash the chicken breasts with a rolling pin or back of a serving spoon and flatten until roughly 1cm thick.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b Set a griddle or large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and heat the remaining 2 tsp of oil. Once hot, place the chicken breasts in the pan and cook for about 5 minutes either side until cooked through. Once cooked, remove the chicken from the pan and set aside on a plate.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b Open the Tilda Rice packet and place in the microwave and cook for 3 minutes.
7b5c37e8-dd8f-4a03-8399-9df17709644b To serve, divide the Super Grains between two large shallow bowls or plates. Slice the chicken and place on top of the rice alongside a serving of the salsa.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Place a large saucepan over a high heat. Add the oil then the onion then turn the heat down to medium. Cook the onion gently for about 8-10 minutes until translucent.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Add the garlic, ginger, lemongrass and chilli to the pan and cook for 3 minutes.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Add the celery, soy sauce, lime juice and water to the pan and bring to the boil then turn down the heat and simmer gently for 15 minutes.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Add the pak choi and rice to the pan then simmer for a further 2 minutes.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Remove the pan from the heat and check for seasoning.
f4942526-0ab7-4777-86e5-17ad58d06c17 Place the Spring onion, Chinese cabbage and coriander into two small bowls and then pour over the broth.
cd487999-c222-4393-83bd-a896e82569e2 Start by chopping your pepper, onion and courgette.
cd487999-c222-4393-83bd-a896e82569e2 Slice your aubergine into long thin pieces, along with the halloumi cheese.
cd487999-c222-4393-83bd-a896e82569e2 For the dips, start by mashing 1/2 an avocado, and seasoning with chilli pepper, and a squeeze of lemon and place in a small bowl.
cd487999-c222-4393-83bd-a896e82569e2 Next, chop the 2 large salad tomatoes, removing the insides and pips and just cutting the outside flesh. Pop this into another little dipping bowl, and season this time with lime, coriander, salt and pepper.
cd487999-c222-4393-83bd-a896e82569e2 Finally, make a yoghurt and mint dip by mixing 50g natural yoghurt with chopped mint, a squeeze of lime and a sprinkle of pepper and add to a third bowl.
eac093c4-300e-478e-bf0c-5b4b7d598a74 Add the rice milk, honey cinnamon and Pure Basmati to the pan
eac093c4-300e-478e-bf0c-5b4b7d598a74 Bring to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes
eac093c4-300e-478e-bf0c-5b4b7d598a74 Whilst the porridge is cooking add the apple, blueberries and water to a separate pan and simmer until the apples have softened and the compote mixture has thickened
eac093c4-300e-478e-bf0c-5b4b7d598a74 Serve the porridge in a large bowl and either swirl through the compote or drizzle over the top. Stir through the pumpkin seeds.
eac093c4-300e-478e-bf0c-5b4b7d598a74 Alternatively, serve simply without the compote by stirring through the dried cranberries and sprinkling with toasted almonds
d3402a24-e483-47f2-9816-0fe5bbe20bfa Separate the gem lettuce leaves from each other and place on a large serving plate
d3402a24-e483-47f2-9816-0fe5bbe20bfa Top each leaf with a spoonful of the Super Grains Sweet Potato, Chilli & Coconut
d3402a24-e483-47f2-9816-0fe5bbe20bfa Sprinkle with the peppers, chives and tomatoes
d3402a24-e483-47f2-9816-0fe5bbe20bfa Make a simple salsa by mixing the mango, red chilli, lime, olive oil and season well with salt and pepper
d3402a24-e483-47f2-9816-0fe5bbe20bfa Serve the filled gem leaves with a little salsa on each
99982daf-c960-4a76-802d-2abb99629354 Put onions, garlic, ginger into pan and add allspice, peppers and runner beans
99982daf-c960-4a76-802d-2abb99629354 Add in diced tomatoes, tofu and coconut milk
99982daf-c960-4a76-802d-2abb99629354 Leave to cook
99982daf-c960-4a76-802d-2abb99629354 Microwave the rice and plate up with the curry mix
99982daf-c960-4a76-802d-2abb99629354 Garnish with coriander, dill and spring onion to serve
8f0986ea-e8f8-4130-81e4-78be43bdb7f7 Marinate tofu in baharat spice and char the cauliflower in a pan
8f0986ea-e8f8-4130-81e4-78be43bdb7f7 Add the broccoli and tofu to the cauliflower in the frying pan and stir through chipotle paste
8f0986ea-e8f8-4130-81e4-78be43bdb7f7 Dice the aubergine and fry in a seperate pan, add with the other ingredients once cooked. Thinly slice a green chilli and add
8f0986ea-e8f8-4130-81e4-78be43bdb7f7 Make a side of smashed avocado with some mint
8f0986ea-e8f8-4130-81e4-78be43bdb7f7 Decant tofu and vegetable mix into a bowl, ready to serve, add the rice. Garnish with mint and pomegranate
41842dba-f13c-40e9-9395-6b0bbe493230 Cook the sweet potato and chickpeas until soft
41842dba-f13c-40e9-9395-6b0bbe493230 Mix coconut milk, red chillies and tamarind paste in a bowl
41842dba-f13c-40e9-9395-6b0bbe493230 Pour this mixture into the chickpea and sweet potato mix
41842dba-f13c-40e9-9395-6b0bbe493230 In a hot pan, make a tempering mixture with oil, mustard seeds and curry leaves
41842dba-f13c-40e9-9395-6b0bbe493230 Pour this mixture into the curry and serve with rice
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Heat the oil in a pan
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Add the cinnamon stick and allow to infuse for two minutes
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Add the vegetables, season with salt and pepper and cook for 10 minutes until soft
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Add the Tilda Steamed Basmati rice, chickpeas, lemon and sultanas
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Cook on a medium heat for around 5 minutes until heated through
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Add the chopped parsley and fluff the rice with a fork
fbf96213-7ddd-4973-9fe7-073b0d4fcf6d Transfer to a serving dish, scatter over the flaked almonds, add dollops of Greek yoghurt and drizzle over the harissa paste
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Cook the rice as per the instructions on the pack, drain and allow to cool
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Melt the coconut oil in a pan over a gentle heat
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Add the almond butter, honey, cacao nibs, sultanas, cinnamon, and oats and combine
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Add the cooked rice and mix together
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Pour the desiccated coconut on a plate
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Allow the mixture to cool until it is cool enough to touch
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Shape the mixture into small balls and roll in the coconut
4b60b4b2-b337-46fa-9eb2-739b47099a61 Refrigerate for a few hours or overnight
c058752b-4895-4293-9932-c8df64b69e87 Peel and chop the ingredients
c058752b-4895-4293-9932-c8df64b69e87 Add all ingredients to a blender
c058752b-4895-4293-9932-c8df64b69e87 Blitz until smooth
c058752b-4895-4293-9932-c8df64b69e87 Serve chilled
f0c82601-8ce1-4f10-93d3-facb50c6d77b Cook the lentils in salted water for 20-30 minutes, drain the water and set aside
f0c82601-8ce1-4f10-93d3-facb50c6d77b Cook the Pure Basmati as per the instructions on the pack
f0c82601-8ce1-4f10-93d3-facb50c6d77b Fry the diced onions in coconut oil, until golden
f0c82601-8ce1-4f10-93d3-facb50c6d77b Transfer the cooked rice to a large bowl and add the lentils, caramelised onions, spices, raisins, pecans and chili oil
f0c82601-8ce1-4f10-93d3-facb50c6d77b Combine the ingredients and serve hot or allow to cool.
3b60867f-5af4-4b01-8a3e-83dbb6aa04fc Combine the chicken with 1 tbsp of the oil and the five spice, allow to marinade for a few minutes
03cd8529-9133-43ba-974e-e313c5fccc68 Heat the oil in a large saucepan and gently cook the onion and garlic for 5 minutes
03cd8529-9133-43ba-974e-e313c5fccc68 Add the paprika and cook for 2 minutes, then add the chickpeas and tomatoes and cook for a further 2 minutes
03cd8529-9133-43ba-974e-e313c5fccc68 Add the stock and bring to the boil, reduce heat and simmer gently for 20 minutes
03cd8529-9133-43ba-974e-e313c5fccc68 Heat the rice according to pack instructions and add to the soup with the spinach and cook for a further 2 minutes
03cd8529-9133-43ba-974e-e313c5fccc68 Serve sprinkled with the parsley and feta if using
8280db14-537d-449f-88cd-4fc58011b766 Place everything except the cacao nibs (if using these) into a blender and pulse a few times to make a rough sticky mixture
8280db14-537d-449f-88cd-4fc58011b766 Remove the mix from the blender and divide into 18 evenly sized balls
8280db14-537d-449f-88cd-4fc58011b766 Take an ice cube tray and press each ball into the mould and place in the freezer for 30 minutes
f70c3f4a-0937-4718-932c-321c7f52ff20 Soak Wild rice grains overnight in a bowl of water.
c4f5cce5-389b-43e6-8708-b27b8740b6a4 Soak goji berries and cranberries in water until required.
c4f5cce5-389b-43e6-8708-b27b8740b6a4 Rinse and drain the Basmati rice.
c211d22d-d849-413d-ab24-368b55fc05a5 Cook the rice as per the instructions on the pack. Half way through cooking, add the vegetable stock cube to the rice.
c211d22d-d849-413d-ab24-368b55fc05a5 Heat the toasted sesame oil in a pan and add onion, garlic and chilli, and cook for two minutes.
c211d22d-d849-413d-ab24-368b55fc05a5 Add the kale, mushrooms, broccoli, leeks, courgette and cook for 5 minutes.
c211d22d-d849-413d-ab24-368b55fc05a5 Add the chicken or alternative meat and soy sauce, and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the meat is browned and cooked through.
c211d22d-d849-413d-ab24-368b55fc05a5 Mix the rice, vegetables and meat together and dress with chopped spring onion.
4ac04d0d-0c45-4b8e-ac72-366228ff8f96 Preheat the oven to 160 degrees.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf Place the rice into a large saucepan of boiling water. Simmer over a medium heat for 25 minutes until tender. Drain well.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf While the rice is cooking make the pesto. Place all the ingredients in a food processor and blend until finely chopped.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf When the rice is almost ready, heat the oil in a frying pan and add the salmon fillets. Cook for 4-5 minutes each side, until golden brown. Remove from the pan and keep warm.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf Add the cherry tomatoes and spinach to the pan and fry for a few minutes until the spinach has wilted and the tomatoes have slightly softened.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf Add the rice and the pesto and blend well.
89c747e9-627a-4571-8862-ceb4e6b017cf Serve on to dishes and top with the salmon.
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Heat the coconut oil in a large pan and fry the onion for 2-3 minutes until soft
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Add the chicken and fry for a further 2-3 minutes
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Add the curry paste, cook for 2 minutes, add the water (if required) and chopped tomatoes. Season to taste
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Cook for 10 -12 minutes then stir in the coconut milk
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Add the cashew nuts and fresh coconut, cook for 5 minutes adding the spinach for the last 2 minutes of cooking
e7d3f99f-7131-471f-869c-983307491429 Stir in the yoghurt and coriander, serve with the cooked rice
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Marinade the chicken in half of lemon juice, olive oil and the paprika for 5mins
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Heat a pan and add the chicken and marinade & cook until golden and cooked through
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Simmer the rice for 10 minutes in a separate pan of boiling water and drain thoroughly. Once drained add to the pan.
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Slice the chicken and add by stir well with the pomegranate seeds, lemon zest and remaining lemon juice
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Heat through for another 2-3 minutes
2750e170-11a8-4ae9-bb88-15fa423e6404 Stir through the coriander and season well with freshly ground black pepper to serve
b5ccd34d-d02b-458c-89b8-414d2f45df13 Peel and deseed the pumpkin and chop into 4cm chunks (keep the seeds for roasting later).
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Fry the chicken in the coconut oil.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Add the vegetables and fry them with the chicken.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Once fried, add the Thai green curry paste, 1 teaspoon of fish oil and the tin of coconut milk.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Bring it all to the boil, reduce heat then leave to simmer for 30 minutes.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Just before it’s finished, add in the spinach and any other greens you fancy, like kale.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Simmer for another few minutes.
2e9ffb4a-dd36-4001-aceb-2f92d5534847 Heat up some Tilda Brown Basmati Steamed rice and serve!
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Add some oil to a deep saucepan, along with spices of your choice and chilli flakes.
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Wait until the oil starts to crackle then add the chopped onions and the garlic to the pan.
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Mix the onions with the spices and leave until the onions are soft.
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Then add half a tin of chopped tomatoes and leave the mixture to simmer for five minutes.
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Add chickpeas and water to the pan.
fd209d17-83ba-41c8-89f8-8582b1e03fbb Cover the saucepan with a lid, lower the heat and leave the curry to thicken for around 5-10 minutes before serving with your favourite Tilda rice.
cb3499bd-b513-4b52-8de4-9aedae25a15a Heat a pouch of Tilda Steamed Pure Basmati rice according to the packet instructions, transfer to a mixing bowl and allow to cool
cb3499bd-b513-4b52-8de4-9aedae25a15a Peel and thinly slice the orange, place the segments on a plate, sprinkle with the molasses sugar and allow it to melt in
cb3499bd-b513-4b52-8de4-9aedae25a15a Stir the cinnamon in to the yoghurt and then gently fold through the rice. Add the slices of orange and sprinkle the almond flakes over the top
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Place the courgette and peppers on a lined roasting tray. Drizzle with 2 tbsps. olive oil and season with salt & pepper. Mix well and place in the oven for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Add the remaining olive oil to a large frying pan. When hot, add the spring onions and cook for one minute before adding the rice. Add the boiling vegetable stock and allow to cook for 3-4 min until heated through.
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Meanwhile toast the pine nuts under the grill for 1/2 minutes until slightly browned.
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Stir through the roasted vegetables and the toasted pine nuts. Remove from heat and add the lemon juice & coriander.
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Season to taste.
dc5a47ed-d8b3-4024-addb-9a82849ffdbd Crumble over the feta cheese.
707fa912-60e5-4090-8746-36315d821bf3 Blitz all of the ingredients together in a smoothie maker or liquidizer until the rice is broken down and the fruit is smooth
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Heat the butter in a large frying pan.
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Add the spring onions and fry gently until softened.
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Add the Pilau rice, lemon zest and juice. Stir well.
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Add the salmon and heat through until piping hot.
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Season well with salt and pepper and stir in the parsley.
b4131b17-af4a-4148-921d-e55a7f7e740c Serve with lemon wedges and quartered hard-boiled eggs.
03bdc2ed-fc90-4243-a4bc-54b248d9e912 Use a steamer to cook the salmon or wrap in foil and bake in the oven for 15 minutes, add the broccoli for the last 5 minutes.
03bdc2ed-fc90-4243-a4bc-54b248d9e912 Meanwhile, heat oil in a saucepan over a medium heat. Cook the onion for five minutes or until soft.
03bdc2ed-fc90-4243-a4bc-54b248d9e912 Add the garlic and lemon rind and cook for one minute or until aromatic.
03bdc2ed-fc90-4243-a4bc-54b248d9e912 Add the Tilda Steamed Wholegrain Basmati & Wild Rice and stir for two minutes or until the grains until heated through. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Then reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
03bdc2ed-fc90-4243-a4bc-54b248d9e912 Remove the skin from the salmon and gently break into flakes. Add the broccoli and salmon to the rice. Stir in the spinach and chives, top the pilaf with almonds and serve with lemon wedges.
d73f2e2b-75f4-454b-a7ee-f66e1e65eadd Heat the oil in a large frying pan and cook the onion, peppers, celery and chorizo for 5 minutes until the vegetables have softened.
d73f2e2b-75f4-454b-a7ee-f66e1e65eadd Meanwhile, heat the rice in a microwave according to the packet instructions.
d73f2e2b-75f4-454b-a7ee-f66e1e65eadd Stir the prawns, tomatoes and spice mix into the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Add the warm rice and continue to stir-fry for a further 2 minutes until the prawns are cooked through and the jambalaya is piping hot.
d73f2e2b-75f4-454b-a7ee-f66e1e65eadd Stir through the parsley and serve.
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Place half the pack of rice and all the other ingredient in a food processor and blitz to a fairly smooth consistency with some flecks of onion and herbs still visible
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Season to taste
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Add the remaining rice and stir well
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Cover with cling film and chill for 30 minutes or longer if you can
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 To make the yoghurt dip blend all the ingredients together and check seasoning
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 For the Tomato and Red Onion salad mix together all the ingredients and season
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Mould the mix into 12 balls and then flatten them into patties
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Heat some oil in a pan and fry the falafels for 3-4 minutes each side over a medium heat, until golden brown
3fdb591d-4bfe-40e0-95bd-195f873c3275 Serve with warmed pittas, the Yoghurt Dip and the Tomato and Onion Salad
5c9746ec-4790-43d8-9ad5-50cf80964177 Heat the rice according to the pack instructions. Mix the mango, avocado, pistachios, pomegranate seeds and salad onions together and stir into the rice mix.
5c9746ec-4790-43d8-9ad5-50cf80964177 Whisk together the oil and vinegar and toss the salad. Serve in a large bowl, with raita on the side if you wish.
5c9746ec-4790-43d8-9ad5-50cf80964177 TIP For a quick raita, stir together Greek yoghurt, grated cucumber and torn mint.
3fc1ca81-5836-4564-95c9-6eaf44022c02 Combine the cooked brown rice, milk and cinnamon in a pan. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes
3fc1ca81-5836-4564-95c9-6eaf44022c02 Beat the egg in a small bowl
3fc1ca81-5836-4564-95c9-6eaf44022c02 Temper the egg by whisking in some of the hot rice, a tablespoon at a time until you have incorporated about six tablespoons
3fc1ca81-5836-4564-95c9-6eaf44022c02 Stir the egg mixture into the rice along with the vanilla and seeds and continue cooking over low heat for one to two minutes to thicken
3fc1ca81-5836-4564-95c9-6eaf44022c02 Stir in the sliced banana and blueberries and drizzle with honey just before serving
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Place the Brown Basmati rice into a saucepan, cover generously with cold water and add a pinch of salt. Bring up to the boil then reduce to a medium heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the rice is tender. Drain thoroughly and spread the rice out across a baking tray to cool.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Preheat the oven to 180C/gas mark 4.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Meanwhile, place the salmon into a roasting tray, season generously and place half of the butter on top of the salmon. Cover the tray with foil and cook in the oven for 8 minutes until just firm, then remove the tin foil and leave to cool. Flake the salmon into a bowl, taking care to remove any fish bones.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Place a frying pan over a low heat and gently melt the remaining butter. Add the shallots and garlic and cook, without colouring, for 3 minutes until softened.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Add the sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until tender, then remove from the heat and stir in the chopped herbs and lemon zest. Spread the mushroom mixture out across a baking tray to cool.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface until 4mm thick. Cut out two 11cm discs and two 15cm discs using pastry cutters. Place the discs carefully onto a lined baking tray and chill in the fridge for 15 minutes.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Mix the cook salmon, rice, mushrooms and boiled eggs together in a large bowl, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Line a baking tray with baking parchment and place the two smaller discs of pastry on the tray. Carefully place a mound of the salmon and rice mixture into the centre of each disc, using a 9cm pastry cutter as a guide for more consistency if desired.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Brush the edge of each pastry base with the egg yolk and carefully place the larger discs over the top, gently pressing down the edges to seal. Brush over the pastry top with the egg yolk to glaze and place in the fridge to chill for 20 minutes.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Preheat the oven to 200C/gas mark 6.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Use a small knife to gently score semi circular patterns down the sides to decorate, trimming the bases with a fluted cutter if desired. Pierce a steam hole in the top of each pie and bake in the oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Meanwhile, prepare the dill sauce. Sweat the shallot and garlic in half the butter over a medium heat, then add the fish stock and continue to cook until reduced by half, then stir in the cream and bring to the boil. Once boiling remove the pan from the heat and whisk in the remaining butter. Pass the sauce through a fine sieve and stir in the dill, seasoning to taste if necessary.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c For the vegetables, place the carrots in a pan and add enough water to just cover. Add half the butter and the sugar, then simmer until the carrots are tender and the water has reduced to a syrup. Add half the pear vinegar and cook for a further 20 seconds, then drain and transfer to a warmed serving dish.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Repeat the process with the leeks, adding them to a pan with just enough water to cover. Add the remaining butter to the pan and cook on a high heat until the leeks are tender, then add the remaining pear vinegar. Reduce until glazed and drain, adding to the serving dish with the carrots.
e5cffe08-de72-445e-a83c-26fe09112b5c Remove the pies from the oven and serve immediately with the glazed vegetables and dill sauce on the side.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b For the rice stage, rinse the rice three times in cold water and drain well
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Place the ﬁsh stock in a large saucepan, bring to the boil and add the bay leaves, turmeric and mixed herbs
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the rice, cover, and cook over a very low heat for 16 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the frozen peas and cook for a further 4 minutes, until the stock is absorbed and the rice is cooked. Remove the bay leaves.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Meanwhile, for the chicken and prawn stage, heat the oil in a paella pan or large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the onion, garlic and chilli ﬂakes and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the red pepper and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes, then add the chicken and stir-fry for a further 6-7 minutes.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Stir in the prawns (and mussels and scallops if using and heat through gently for 4-5 minutes. Ensure the scallops are thoroughly cooked.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the seafood mixture to the rice and stir gently to combine.
3b5e637e-c197-4a67-aa61-17bf5fec1a9b Add the lemon juice and serve immediately.
0d5f420d-18f9-49cc-880d-0a5ae5b4edcc Rinse the rice is cold water until the water runs clears – set aside in a sieve to allow as much water as possible to drain off.
f293d5e6-bb11-4845-9253-5b346828d0fb Bend the turkey mince, breadcrumbs, black pepper, salt, herbs and chilli paste together in a bowl. Form into 12 mini meatballs. Refrigerate if time.
a91e440c-f982-4588-b22b-4ae5a84397d8 Chop courgettes
debc7ee8-4031-4e3a-9ec8-e7f8361cd6f3 Bring large pan water to the boil and add the vinegar. Poach the eggs: stir the boiling water to form a whirlpool and crack the eggs into the water one or two at a time. Poach for 3-4 minutes, remove with a slotted spoon and set aside
debc7ee8-4031-4e3a-9ec8-e7f8361cd6f3 Meanwhile heat the olive oil in large pan with a lid. Add the asparagus, coat in the oil, add the stock or water and a tsp of the butter, season to taste. Cover with lid and cook gently for 3-4 minutes
debc7ee8-4031-4e3a-9ec8-e7f8361cd6f3 Remove the asparagus from the pan and set aside. Simmer the cooking liquid until halved, add the tsp remaining butter and a dash balsamic vinegar to taste
debc7ee8-4031-4e3a-9ec8-e7f8361cd6f3 Heat the rice according to pack instruction and divide between 4 plates
debc7ee8-4031-4e3a-9ec8-e7f8361cd6f3 Top with 3 asparagus spears and a poached egg, drizzle with some of the sauce and serve
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Preheat oven to 180°c, gas mark 6.
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the garlic, shallots and fennel and fry gently until soft for about 3-5 minutes.
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Add the stock or wine, passatta and red pepper. Fry for about 5 minutes.
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Add the fish and seafood mix and transfer to an ovenproof dish or tagine. Lay the clams on top. Season to taste.
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Cover and cook for about 20 minutes or until the clam shells have opened.
214a8f9d-b065-4589-a98e-50fca917e600 Serve with heated Tilda Lemon & Herb rice.
0968b31e-02b1-4c46-a114-bd54db908091 Cook the rice as per the instructions on the pack
0968b31e-02b1-4c46-a114-bd54db908091 At the same time, heat the oil then gently fry the chilli, cumin and halloumi for 2 minutes
0968b31e-02b1-4c46-a114-bd54db908091 Add the sun blushed tomatoes, olives and chickpeas and heat through for a further 3 minutes
0968b31e-02b1-4c46-a114-bd54db908091 Stir in cooked Basmati rice, rocket, coriander, mint and lemon
0968b31e-02b1-4c46-a114-bd54db908091 Serve hot with greek yogurt drizzled over and warm flat bread
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Begin by charring the peppers. Use metal tongs to hold the peppers directly over an open flame on a gas stove. Carefully roast the pepper for about a minute on each side before turning and until all sides are blackened. Once blackened, pile all peppers onto a sheet of foil and wrap tightly so that the peppers continue to steam for 5 minutes
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Once cool enough to handle, peel and discard the black skins, stems and seeds and finely slice. Mix into a bowl with the halved olives, a pinch of sea salt and a little lemon zest. Set aside to serve later
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df To cook the rice, wash in a colander with cold water and set aside. Carefully melt the butter over a low heat in a medium-sized saucepan, the crush the grains of paradise in a pestle and mortar and add to the melted butter, along with the grated ginger and garlic
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Cook for 2 minutes before adding the rice to the spiced butter. Water will sizzle in hot oil, so drain the rice properly
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Pour in 400ml of vegetable stock, 200ml of water and a teaspoon of sea salt. Bring the rice to the boil then turn down the heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Once cooked, fluff with a fork
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df To make the yassa, heat two tablespoons of oil in a sauté pan and add the onions. Sprinkle with a pinch or two of sea salt to extract moisture from the onions and cook for 10 minutes over a low-medium heat, stirring occasionally until softened and translucent. Once cooked, add the garlic, ginger and fragrant smoked paprika. Stir and cook for two minutes
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Mix the lemon juice with the remaining lemon zest and Dijon mustard. Add to the sauté pan with fish stock, stir well and add the finely chopped (or pierced) scotch bonnet. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes to slightly thicken the sauce
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Add sea salt and then carefully lower the fish into the sauce, with a few sprigs of lemon thyme and freshly ground grains of paradise. Cook covered on medium heat for 10 minutes. If using fish with skin, take out the fish after 5 minutes and grill in a preheated oven for the final 5 minutes to crisp it up
4b65fb33-9a16-40c6-aefa-a1da44b6b4df Serve the fish with the rice and pepper salad for a sweet, vibrant and lip-smacking West African feast!
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Fill a pan with water and place on high heat.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Add ¼ cup salt and bring to a boil.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Add rice and cook for 6-8mins. Once the rice has parboiled, remove from hob and drain.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 While the rice is cooling, add ¾ cup barberries to a pan with a small knob of butter. Allow the barberries to plump up slightly and cook on low-medium heat for about 5 minutes.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 In a separate bowl whisk together egg yolks, yoghurt and crushed saffron.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Add the parboiled rice to the bowl and mix well so all the rice is covered in yoghurt mixture.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Grease a baking dish and add half the amount of rice mixture.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Sprinkle barberries on the top half of the rice (save some to decorate the top too).
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Add remaining half of rice and use and gently pat down the top layer evenly.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Cover the dish with foil and place in oven for 50mins- 1hr.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Remove from oven and flip dish over to remove rice cake on a plate.
812e3b39-c6fd-471b-9765-dffd9ee33277 Sprinkle barberries and crushed pistachios on top of rice cake to decorate.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Take a saucepan or a casserole large enough to hold all the tomatoes at one time as well as the rice when cooked
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Wash and halve or quarter the tomatoes and add to the pot
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Place on the cooker on a high heat & add approximately 500ml of hot or boiling water and boil for eight to ten minutes.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Meanwhile in a mortar and pestle make a paste of the ginger & garlic and add to the tomatoes
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Either puree the tomatoes or pass through a strainer. A stick blender with puree it fine even with the skins
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Heat the oil in a small pan or kadhai or wok and gently brown the sliced onions.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Meanwhile wash and drain the rice in a strainer
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Remove half on a kitchen towel and to the pan add the peppercorns, cloves.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Add the rice and sauté the rice with the onions and the spices for two to three minutes
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Add all of this into the pureed tomato with the ginger and garlic purees and return to the fire.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Add another 4-500ml of hot water, salt and cover the pot lightly
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a As soon as boiling commences stir well and see if anything is stuck at the bottom.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Scrape the edges with a spatula to clean the sides, cover the pot now tightly and reduce the heat
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Let the rice cook on a low heat now for fifteen to twenty minutes
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Stir occasionally if only to prevent sticking at the bottom.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a When rice is cooked either remove and serve with the browned onions and coriander sprinkled on the top or blend the fried onions and chopped coriander into the rice.
ed14b259-39f2-43cc-ba26-b1d0d73a520a Tomato rice will also taste good cold served with yoghurt.
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 Heat the oil in a large pan and sauté the shallots and garlic for 4–5 minutes. Add the pumpkin, thyme and flaked almonds and sauté for a further 8–10 minutes
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 Add the rice and mix well before pouring in the vegetable stock. At this point you can continue to cook the dish in the pan, covered, for 20–25 minutes, or bake as suggested below
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 Preheat the oven to 180°C/gas mark 4
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 To bake, spoon the mixture into a large gratin dish and scatter over ¾ of the grated cheese, cover with foil and bake the oven for 20 minutes.
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 After 20 minutes, remove the foil and bake for a further 20–25 minutes until the cheese is golden brown and the rice is cooked
50775163-45af-4856-8fef-29d18b4d8e64 Serve with the remaining grated cheese, salad and crusty bread or seasonal greens
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Cook the rice according to the packet instructions. Once cooked, drain the rice and set aside to steam-dry
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 While the rice cooks, heat 1 teaspoon of sesame oil in a medium to large saucepan over a moderate heat. Once hot, add the diced onion and finely chopped celery and sweat for 8 minutes until they have softened, become translucent and started to slightly caramelise
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Add the garlic, ginger and chilli and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the sliced carrot and continue to stir-fry for 5 minutes
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Meanwhile, drain the silken tofu in a sieve or a colander
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 After 5 minutes, add the peas and baby corn and stir well. Stir-fry for 4 minutes to heat through
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Add the cooked and drained rice, stir well to combine and then make a well in the centre of the saucepan. Turn the heat up high and add your tofu to the well – it should sizzle immediately. Sprinkle the turmeric and the kala namak over the tofu
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Hold your nerve here with the heat; after two minutes start to stir and break up the tofu and incorporate this into the rice and veggies. Continue to stir-fry the fried rice for 6 minutes, or longer if you prefer it drier and crispier
d63c1476-9583-4440-90c1-0fdc62724442 Serve in warmed bowls, sprinkled with sliced spring onions, fresh lime wedges or a squeeze of lime juice, toasted sesame seeds and 2 tablespoons of kimchi per bowl
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c First make the marinade. Put the onions into a bowl and rub them gently under running cold water. Drain well in a colander, then dry in a salad spinner or with kitchen paper.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Heat the oil in a deep pan. When hot, fry the onions in 3 separate batches until pale golden. Using a slotted spoon, transfer them to a colander, where they will continue to brown in their own heat. The oil can be reused another time if cooled and strained.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Put all but 2 tablespoons of the fried onions into a blender, add the remaining marinade ingredients and whiz to a purée. You might need to do this in batches so that the machine can create a smooth paste and the motor doesn’t overheat. Transfer the mixture to a large flameproof casserole dish.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Trim any excess skin from the chicken pieces, then place the meat in the marinade. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and set aside in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF/Gas Mark 4. Transfer the casserole dish to the oven and cook for about 1 hour, until the chicken is tender.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Meanwhile, cook the potatoes in a pan of boiling salted water for about 8–10 minutes, until tender. Drain and set aside.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Put the measured water into a large saucepan with the bay leaves and some salt and bring to the boil. Add the rice and boil for roughly 6 minutes, until al dente. Drain well, reserving the water to make soup if you wish. Fork through the rice to loosen the grains.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Heat the saffron threads in a warm small frying pan over a gentle heat until they are crisp. Add 2–3 tablespoons of water and set aside to rest for 10 minutes.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Pour the saffron and its liquid over the rice while still in the colander and mix lightly to partially colour the grains.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c When the chicken is ready, the sauce might look too thin or a bit oily, but don’t worry about that. Heat it, uncovered, for a few minutes to reduce it if you wish, but a generous amount of sauce is needed to finish the dish. Taste and adjust the salt if necessary, then add the fresh mint and coriander. Transfer the chicken to a plate and pour the sauce into a jug. Lower the oven temperature to 150ºC/300ºF/Gas Mark 2.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Return some of the sauce to the empty casserole dish and cover with one-third of the rice. Arrange the chicken pieces and a few chunks of potato on top, then cover with another third of the rice. Pour over some more sauce, dot with the remaining potatoes and cover with the remaining rice. Press down gently. Drizzle the remaining sauce over the rice, sprinkle with the reserved onions and the melted butter and cover tightly.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Place on the middle shelf of the oven for up to 40 minutes to heat through fully. If the ingredients have become cold during the process of putting the dish together, they might need longer to heat through. In this case, lower the temperature to 120ºC/250ºF/Gas Mark ½ and continue heating until completely hot.
395619c2-8d16-4eb3-9277-cb1698b94d7c Serve the biryani with Mixed Raita or a daal, allowing people to help themselves straight from the dish if you like.
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Prepare a broth for the chicken and coconut rice by heating a tablespoon of coconut oil in a wide saucepan. Add the sliced onion and cook over a medium heat until softened, then add the garlic and ginger and cook for 2 minutes
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Lightly toast the whole seeds in a hot dry frying pan for a minute or until darker in colour, then crush with a pestle and mortar and add to the onions. Add the curry powder and stir
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Throw in the bay leaf, coconut milk, crushed whole uda pod and sea salt. Stir well, bring the broth to the boil and add the chicken thighs. Reduce heat to low, cover and poach for 5 minutes
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Remove the uda pod and poached chicken from the broth with a slotted spoon and place in a colander to drain
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b For the coconut rice, rinse the rice, drain well and add to the coconut broth. Cook tightly covered over a medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the chopped carrots and green beans, then cook for a further 5 minutes
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Check the rice for doneness and, if needed, add 100–200ml of water at a time. Continue to cook until the rice is tender. Once cooked, sprinkle with chopped spring onions and fluff the rice with a fork
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b For the suya, dry roast the peanuts in a hot frying pan until golden then crush into a fine powder using a pestle and mortar or food processor. Transfer to a muslin cloth and squeeze out as much oil as possible, until you are left with a cakey peanut residue
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Crush the uda pods as finely as possible, separating and discarding the coarse bark. Mix the peanuts and crushed uda pods with the garlic, ginger and chilli powder, then season with sea salt. Save a tablespoon or two of the suya spices for garnish, and use the rest to coat both sides of the poached chicken thighs
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Heat a grill or griddle pan until smoking hot. Brush the chicken on both sides with coconut oil and grill for 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and leave to rest. Place the beef tomatoes and onions on the grill until charred
d114a155-8180-4a20-9cf6-45ead7fe342b Slice the grilled chicken into thin strips and serve with the coconut rice, char-grilled onions and tomatoes and a sprinkling of the reserved suya spices, just like you would get on the bustling streets of Lagos
50a20e5e-6913-42e5-89fb-aa7780352db7 To make the ketchup, place the apples, sugar, ajwain seeds and vinegar in a saucepan and set over a medium heat. Bring to the boil and cook the apples until they are very soft.
50a20e5e-6913-42e5-89fb-aa7780352db7 Drain the apples, reserving the liquid in the pan. Place the apple mixture into a blender and blitz until smooth. Add the lemon juice and enough of the reserved cooking liquid to reach a thick ketchup-like consistency. Store any extra ketchup in an airtight container in the fridge for a week or so.
44dbc439-cbce-4ae3-8c8c-62a8fee88488 Heat the oven to 180C
44dbc439-cbce-4ae3-8c8c-62a8fee88488 Coat the diced butternut squash in a little oil and a sprinkle of cumin seeds and chilli. Bake for 25 minutes until soft and charred. Remove and cool.
44dbc439-cbce-4ae3-8c8c-62a8fee88488 Coat the kale in a sprinkle of oil with some cumin and cook in the oven for 10 minutes until crisp – do not let it brown too much. Remove and leave to cool.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Dissolve the sugar and the vinegar in a bowl.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Heat the oil in a heavy pan and add all the spices until they sizzle & become fragrant. This should only take a minute.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Very gently, pour the vinegar and sugar mixture into the pan with the spices and stir. Bring this to a simmer.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Add in the tomatoes and cook on a very low heat until they have softened and have gone pulpy (about 45 minutes to 1 hour).
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Season with salt and chilli powder then stir to keep it from sticking. If you want to remove any of the tomato skins then do so with some tongs.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Put the chutney into a sterilised glass jar and leave to cool.
568741d6-0ac8-4fd0-83de-857fbe640332 Once cooled seal the jar. The chutney will keep for 4-6 weeks. Refrigerate once opened.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd In a wide, heavy bottom sauce pan, add the rice, full fat milk and coconut milk, and heat over medium heat. Keep stirring it and bring to the boil.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd Simmer and stir in the maple syrup and the crushed cardamom seeds.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd This needs to cook gently for about 30 minutes. Make sure you stir the rice so it doesn’t stick. If it feels too dry just add a little more milk.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd Test the rice by squeezing it between your fingers. Once it's soft and cooked through the pudding should have a lovely creamy consistency, remove it from the heat and cover with a lid.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd In a frying pan heat the coconut oil and add cashew nuts to toast slightly, add the pistachios and raisins and fry for a few seconds.
9ed43163-5672-4132-8af6-ed0d83a18cbd Pour the fried nuts along with the butter over the Payasam with a sprinkle of the coconut and pomegranate seeds, and serve warm.
139e9a23-921a-470b-8642-8e03e83aec47 To begin, heat oil in a pan. Add the cinnamon, cloves, cardamom pods, chillies and peppercorns and fry for 1 minute. Add the onion and fry until golden-brown.
139e9a23-921a-470b-8642-8e03e83aec47 Stir in the tomatoes, a generous pinch of salt and the turmeric. Cook for a further 7–10 minutes. Add the mussels and allow to cook through.
139e9a23-921a-470b-8642-8e03e83aec47 Add the rice and water to the pan and leave to cook with a lid on until the rice is tender. Serve immediately with some fresh coriander.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Put a medium sauce pan on a medium heat, add the oil and the garlic and fry till fragrant.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Add the tomato and lemongrass base.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Add 2 tbsp. water and stir, simmer for 2 mins.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Add 1 tbsp. soy sauce and ½ a tsp. sugar and mix well.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Add the chopped aubergine, add 150 ml of water simmer for a minute, add the rest of the fish sauce and sugar.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Mix well and add the turmeric, pepper and the lemongrass stalk. Simmer for about 12mins or until the aubergine is cooked. Add the spring onion and stir in. Cook for a further minute.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Serve in a warm dish or clay pot and garnish with lots of chopped herbs with white rice on the side.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Scale and fillet the bream, pin bone and lightly score the fish fillets.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Finely chop the chilli and garlic
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Place the chilli, sugar, vinegar, fish sauce and water in a pan and bring to the boil, reduce the heat and simmer until the mix starts to thicken, add the garlic and continue to cook until the mix is thickened.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Peel and julienne the green mango. Toss in a little lime juice with a pinch of salt.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Heat a frying pan until hot, season the fish skin with a little salt and cook skin side down until crisp and golden, drizzle the skin with the glaze and then flash the fish under the grill to finish, serve on a bed of the mango with some of the mango scattered over the top, garnish with fresh Vietnamese mint and coriander.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Place the rice and coconut in a small saucepan and pour in the oil and salt, stir together. Alternatively heat up Tilda Coconut rice for 2 minutes in the microwave and serve.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Cover the rice by 1 cm with boiling water and then bring to the boil.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Reduce the heat and simmer the rice with a lid on until all the water has been absorbed.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Lightly fluff the rice, stir in the coconut milk and then place a clean tea towel over the top of the pan and recover with the lid; this will allow the rice to steam.
43a4eb25-25dc-43f0-9906-729ef030c819 Fluff the rice again before serving.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b For the dough, place the flour into a large bowl and stir the hot water gradually into it, mixing all the time, until the water is incorporated.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b Tip the dough mixture onto a clean work surface and knead it with your hands, dusting the dough with a little flour if it's sticky. Continue kneading until smooth - this should take about eight minutes, then allow to rest for 20 minutes.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b For the stuffing, while the dough is resting, combine the stuffing ingredients in a large bowl and mix them together thoroughly.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b Shape the dough into a roll about 20cm long and about 2.5cm in diameter, then with a sharp knife, slice the roll into 16 equal-sized pieces and roll each piece into a small ball. With a rolling pin, roll each ball into a small, round, flat 'pancake' - about 9cm in diameter.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b Place about two teaspoons of filling in the centre of each 'pancake' and moisten the edges with water. Fold the dough in half and pinch together with your fingers.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b Pleat around the edge, pinching with your fingers to seal well. The dumplings should look like a small Cornish pasty with a flat base and rounded top.
f1b38650-aa82-4227-a1a0-ee5f9a8ce05b To cook, steam in a basket for about 8 minutes. Alternatively, they can be fried. For the dipping sauce, combine all the ingredients in a small bowl.
9728ce9a-17a4-427d-aa17-9f9a59d31a10 Slice the red onions, chillies and runner beans, and chop the garlic finely
c57eea58-3d16-4fa5-bd13-d9035aba6131 Add sliced red onion, broccoli florets and grated sweet potato to a pan and saute
c57eea58-3d16-4fa5-bd13-d9035aba6131 Add chopped garlic and ginger to the pan with a spoonful of black mustard seeds, 1 tbsp of curry powder and some thinly sliced chilli
c57eea58-3d16-4fa5-bd13-d9035aba6131 Pour in a cup of coconut milk, stir well and leave to simmer
c57eea58-3d16-4fa5-bd13-d9035aba6131 Add cod fillets, stir and leave to cook through
c57eea58-3d16-4fa5-bd13-d9035aba6131 Microwave Tilda coconut rice for two minutes, plate up with the rice and enjoy the delicious taste of Southern India
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Heat the oil in a large saucepan, and add the diced onion. Cook over a medium heat for a few minutes, until the onion is soft and translucent.
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Peel the sweet potatoes, and cut into 2cm dice. Add to the pan, along with the vegetable stock. Cover the pan with a lid, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Cook for around 25 minutes until the sweet potato is very soft - you should be able to squash a piece with the back of your spoon.
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until it’s fairly smooth. Add the red Thai curry paste and coconut milk, and mix well.
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Next add the Super Grains Sweet Potato, Chilli & Coconut, and cook for just a few more minutes until the grains are completely cooked.
5f291234-e141-4e2d-b9b6-872b10b6bfd4 Serve the soup with plenty of garnish - fresh coriander, sliced spring onions and sliced mild chillies are all good options.
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Preheat the oven to 200°C/gas mark 6
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 To begin, soak the dried chilli in a bowl of boiling water for 20 minutes using 300ml water – the quantity is important as this is the water you'll use later to cook your rice. You may need to weigh your chilli down with a spoon if it keeps floating to the surface
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Mix the plantain with the paprika and oil. Lightly season, spread out on a tray and bake in the oven for 15–20 minutes, turning over halfway through. They should be soft when cooked and just starting to crisp up
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Take the chilli out of the water and pat dry with some kitchen paper. At this stage, you can keep it whole or you can split it in half. If you like things spicy, go for the latter
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Heat the oil in a saucepan over a medium heat and add the chilli, stirring around for a minute or two. Add the garlic, cinnamon, cumin and lime peel. Stir around for another minute before adding the rice and the oregano. Once more, stir for a minute to ensure that all the flavours are mixing in with the rice
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Finally, add the water used to soak the chilli and bring to a boil. Reduce to a bare simmer, cover and leave to cook for 12 minutes. When the 12 minutes is up, turn the heat off but leave covered for at least another 10 minutes
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 Meanwhile, prepare the mixed beans by placing a saucepan over a medium heat and adding a splash of oil. Add the herbs, stirring through for a minute, then add the beans. Reduce the heat and keep an eye on things, stirring every now and then. You want the beans to break down a touch and thicken. If things begin to look too dry, add a splash of water
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 When the rice is ready, take off the lid and remove all the larger aromatics – the chilli, garlic and cinnamon stick – all of which should be on the top of the rice. Fluff up with a fork and season with lime juice and salt
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 To serve, lay everything out in bowls and plates and let everyone dig in for themselves. Layer up with rice, plantain and beans and garnish with sour cream and salsa. Finish with a scattering of coriander (and maybe some more lime juice) and then roll and wrap up both ends to create a burrito
c07768e1-d678-4483-9675-cb7ebd964731 You can use Tilda Pure Basmati Rice as an alternative.
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 To begin, make the marinade. Finely mince the garlic and coriander stems. Dissolve the sugar in the warm water, then combine all the ingredients for the marinade in a bowl, stirring to mix well. Rub all over the chicken and let the chicken sit in the marinade in a large ziplock bag overnight. Turn the bag occasionally so that all sides stay coated with the marinade
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 On the day of cooking, preheat the oven to 160°C/gas mark 3
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 Take the chicken out of the fridge and let it come back up to room temperature. Pat with paper towels to remove the marinade and place on a roasting tray
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 Drizzle lightly with oil, place on the oven’s middle rack and roast for 2 hours, basting it regularly with its own juices. Turn the oven up to 220°C/gas mark 8 and let the chicken cook for another 15–20 minutes, or until golden brown
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 While the chicken is in the oven, prepare the other elements of the dish. Wash and drain the rice. Cover with cold water and leave to soak. Blitz all the ingredients for the green sauce together, adding just enough oil to make a smooth runny sauce, sort of like a pesto. Season to taste with salt. Keep the sauce covered in the refrigerator so it doesn’t lose its vibrant green
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 When the chicken is ready, remove it from the oven, lifting it from the tin onto a chopping board, and cover loosely with a foil tent
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 While the chicken is resting, drain and tip the rice into a rice cooker. Pour the chicken roasting juices into a measuring jug and top up with enough water so you have 300ml liquid altogether. Add to the rice and let the rice cooker do its magic
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 For those without a rice cooker, bring the rice and roast chicken juices to a boil in a saucepan, then cover and turn the heat down to the lowest setting. Let the rice cook, undisturbed, for about 10–15 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Turn the heat off, give the rice a stir, and put the lid back on, letting it finish cooking by steaming in the pan’s residual heat, for another 5 minutes
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 When ready to serve, carve and chop the chicken into generous bite-sized pieces before serving with the fragrant rice and green sauce
1265102c-fa85-415d-bc3e-5db72d035001 You can use Tilda Pure Basmati Rice as an alternative.
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 To begin, heat the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Sauté the bay leaves for 10 seconds and add sliced onions. Fry until deep golden brown
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 While the onions are cooking, place a large pan of water to boil. Wash and soak the rice in a large bowl of lukewarm water. Place the fish stock in a saucepan over medium heat, reduce by half and set aside
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 Grind the ingredients for the herb paste in a food processor and set aside
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 When the onions are browned, add the turmeric, fry for a minute and add the herb paste. Fry for a further 2–3 minutes, add the yoghurt and stir well to combine. Cook for a further 5 minutes and remove from heat
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 Add the cinnamon, cardamom, cloves and salt to the pan of boiling water, simmer for 5 minutes then remove the spices and discard. Drain the soaked rice and add to the boiling water, stirring gently
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 Meanwhile, heat the pan containing the herb mixture and add the scallops, prawns and crab meat. Sauté for a minute, stirring gently. Add the reduced fish stock and remove a few prawns and scallops for garnish
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 Check the rice – once it is three quarters cooked, drain in a colander and add to the pan containing the herbs and seafood. Stir gently to mix the herbs and seafood into the rice. Check the seasoning, add the lemon juice and leave to simmer for 10 minutes
37593f4d-3755-4611-881c-04d828f1a510 To serve, divide the biryani between bowls and garnish with a few of the reserved king prawns and scallops. Add a sprinkling of toasted pine nuts, lemon zest and dill fronds. Serve hot
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 To begin, lightly dust the duck breasts with the Thai 7-Spice and leave to marinate for an hour in the fridge
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 Meanwhile, make the curry paste by simply placing all the ingredients (apart from the coriander leaves) in a blender. Blitz to a rough and ready paste. Place in a bowl or jar and cover (you may have some left over, so a jar might be preferable
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 For the crispy shallots, pour the oil into a saucepan and place over a high heat. When the hot is oil (not smoking though) throw in the shallot rounds. They will bubble up immediately and the key here is to keep a close eye on proceedings. As they bubble, the water will evaporate and the bubbling will slowly begin to die down after about 8 minutes or so, when the shallots will begin to become golden and crisp. Don’t let them go too far, or they will burn. Scoop out with a slotted spoon and allow to drain and cool on kitchen paper. These can now be stored in an airtight container
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 Remove the duck breasts from the fridge and allow to come up to room temperature
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 Preheat the oven to 180°C/gas mark 4Place the duck breasts skin-side down in a cold frying pan then place over a medium to high heat. This method helps to slowly render the fat out of the duck, crisping up the skin beautifully. After 5 minutes, flip the breasts and place in the oven to finish cooking – 10–12 minutes is good for medium, 15 minutes for well done. Once the duck breasts are ready, leave to rest in a warm spot for another 10 minutes
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 While the duck is cooking, prepare the rice by heating a wide saucepan or wok on the hob over a high heat. Add a generous splash of oil and then 4 tablespoons of the red curry paste. Or a bit more if you like things spicy. Less if you don’t. Stir briskly for a good couple of minutes, to cook the paste out
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 Add the rice and stir to toast for 1 minute. Add the coconut milk and 100ml of water and cover with a lid. Cook until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed, then stir through the white parts of the spring onions. Remove from the heat and stir through the diced mango
4973b821-adfe-47cc-83d4-874ccdf1b770 To serve, slice the rested duck breasts evenly. Divide the rice between plates, place the duck breasts on top and garnish with the crispy shallots. Chop some of the reserved coriander leaves, sprinkle over and serve
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Dry fry the cumin and mustard seeds until they start to pop. Remove from heat and grind in pestle and mortar.
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Fry the onion, garlic, ginger and chilli until it softens and turns brown.
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Add the dry spices (or curry powder) to the cumin and mustard and mix in the tomato purée to make a paste. Add this to the pan and continue to fry for 1-2 mins.
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Pour in the water and simmer on a medium heat for a further 20-25 mins and add the leftover turkey.
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Add the green pepper and continue to cook for 5 mins.
3cc24302-ab1c-4283-8bf0-a3d049d13de3 Serve with basmati rice and garnish with fresh coriander and a squeeze of lemon juice.
53e8c120-af5b-45b2-a085-221191be96fa In a bowl mix the soy sauce, mirin, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, garlic and grated ginger until sugar dissolves.
53e8c120-af5b-45b2-a085-221191be96fa Add the chicken and marinate for 15 mins or preferably overnight in the fridge.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Lightly grease a mini cupcake tin.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Cut filo sheets to approx. 8cm by 8cm square.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Dip each sheet into whisked egg, coating both sides.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Layer 3 squares in each hole.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Scrunch the corners in to create a crinkled circle edge.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Cook in the oven at 200c for 10 minutes.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Meanwhile pour coconut milk, milk and cream and bring to the boil in a large pan. Scrape vanilla seeds into the mix with a sharp knife.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Add sugar and Tilda Steamed Coconut Basmati to the pan and simmer for 20 minutes until the rice begins to soften further and the mix has thickened.
12bf826c-5cbf-431b-9a18-7d9cdc40ec09 Spoon mixture into the filo cases and top with passion fruit (pineapple also works well).
911ff3a8-825b-43c3-9b67-16133de14288 Chop onion, garlic, ginger and pan fry
911ff3a8-825b-43c3-9b67-16133de14288 Chop sweet potato and microwave to soften
911ff3a8-825b-43c3-9b67-16133de14288 Add sweet potato to pan and 2 tsp of tagine paste/1 tsp of sumac spice
911ff3a8-825b-43c3-9b67-16133de14288 Chop the carrot, dice up the tomatoes and add along with the chicken and chicken stock cube/ water
911ff3a8-825b-43c3-9b67-16133de14288 Simmer with lid on until cooked. Serve with rice and lemon
4f17287e-49f4-4caa-aa75-a8c24d5a5f2c Marinate raw chicken with curry paste and coconut milk
61b55faf-7eac-4789-b4a2-a184cfb6b696 Add onion, garlic and ginger to pan, with cubed sweet potatoes
61b55faf-7eac-4789-b4a2-a184cfb6b696 Add peppers, a bit of coconut milk, a tbsp of chipotle paste and a pinch of ground allspice
61b55faf-7eac-4789-b4a2-a184cfb6b696 Marinate cod in chipotle paste and set aside
61b55faf-7eac-4789-b4a2-a184cfb6b696 Add in broccoli and cod, leave to simmer. Steam the rice and add in with a touch of chilli
61b55faf-7eac-4789-b4a2-a184cfb6b696 Dish up and garnish with spring onion, chilli, parsley and a squeeze of lime
6f03d4ac-9510-45b2-bbe3-250874107f97 Add shallots, ginger, turmeric and mustard seeds into a pan. In another pan char the cauliflower and set aside
6f03d4ac-9510-45b2-bbe3-250874107f97 Add coconut milk, let it simmer whilst the flavours infuse
6f03d4ac-9510-45b2-bbe3-250874107f97 Add aubergine, peppers, charred cauliflower, chillies and coriander
6f03d4ac-9510-45b2-bbe3-250874107f97 Add in the cod and leave to simmer. Season with salt and pepper to taste
6f03d4ac-9510-45b2-bbe3-250874107f97 Plate the rice in a circle with the curry in the middle
cfe3092e-d55b-44e7-bde0-89039cfaaf62 Fry the red onion in a pan
cfe3092e-d55b-44e7-bde0-89039cfaaf62 Add chicken, jerk paste and garlic to pan and fry until cooked
cfe3092e-d55b-44e7-bde0-89039cfaaf62 Make a salsa in a separate bowl: chop up tomato, spring onion, avocado and add sweetcorn and lime juice
cfe3092e-d55b-44e7-bde0-89039cfaaf62 Add broccoli, peppers, sweetcorn to a pan and steam until vegetables are soft
cfe3092e-d55b-44e7-bde0-89039cfaaf62 Add chicken mix and vegetables together with rice and serve with the salsa
7701a65d-d7c6-4dcf-b2da-e8af6c4462df Chop onion and garlic and fry in pan
7701a65d-d7c6-4dcf-b2da-e8af6c4462df Add chicken and baharat spice to the pan
7701a65d-d7c6-4dcf-b2da-e8af6c4462df Season the mix with black pepper and add the cauliflower
7701a65d-d7c6-4dcf-b2da-e8af6c4462df Add the rice straight from the packet along with chickpeas and coconut milk
7701a65d-d7c6-4dcf-b2da-e8af6c4462df Add chopped tomato and parsley and leave to simmer, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper and serve
f69a6f22-64c3-48d4-ba4f-3c9556fba1a4 Add onions, garlic, orange, spring onion and chilli into pan and add kidney beans
f69a6f22-64c3-48d4-ba4f-3c9556fba1a4 Add rice and stir well on a medium heat
f69a6f22-64c3-48d4-ba4f-3c9556fba1a4 Marinate cod with jerk paste and coconut milk. Cook in a pan
f69a6f22-64c3-48d4-ba4f-3c9556fba1a4 Add in kidney beans and vegetable mix
f69a6f22-64c3-48d4-ba4f-3c9556fba1a4 Garnish with sweet potato chips and toasted coconut
acf8e4f4-af02-430c-9f40-65b805b55876 Chop all vegetables to equal size, put in a pot with the chicken and some vegetable stock
